learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course the student will be able to:
(i) understand targets and operation of business/non-profit organizations
(ii) apply professional practices in the field of his/her major/programme as a member of an business/non-profit organization
(iii) identify development needs/opportunities in organizations and their practices and
(iv) assess and describe own professional development as part of personal career development and employment plan.
learningOutcomes.sv: After the course the student will be able to:(i) understand targets and operation of business/non-profit organizations(ii) apply professional practices in the field of his/her major/programme as a member of an business/non-profit organization(iii) identify development needs/opportunities in organizations and their practices and(iv) assess and describe own professional development as part of personal career development and employment plan.
learningOutcomes.en: After the course the student will be able to:(i) understand targets and operation of business/non-profit organizations(ii) apply professional practices in the field of his/her major/programme as a member of an business/non-profit organization(iii) identify development needs/opportunities in organizations and their practices and(iv) assess and describe own professional development as part of personal career development and employment plan.

content.fi: The student agrees on a professional training placement with the supervising professor (head of major), prepares a personalized learning plan for the training period, works as a member of a business or non-profit organization in a position that is relevant for her/his professional skills development and reflects her/his learning in writing in a personal expert profile. The training is completed in another country than Finland or in another country than the home country of the student.

The training is completed in another country than Finland or in another country than the home country of the student.

The training is completed in another country than Finland or in another country than the home country of the student.

organizationName.en: Department of Chemical and Metallurgical Engineering

prerequisites.fi: Pakolliset esitiedot: 110 op kandidaatintutkintoon kuuluvia opintoja, perus- ja pääaineopinnot pääosin suoritettu. Seminaariin ilmoittautuessa seuraavat kurssit tulee olla suoritettuna: CHEM-A1100 Teollisuuden toimintaympäristö ja prosessit CHEM-A1120 Virtaustekniikka ja lämmönsiirto CHEM-A1270 Yleinen kemia CHEM-A1280 Kemian peruslaboratoriotyöt CHEM-A1290 Orgaanisen kemian peruskurssi CHEM-A1205 Orgaanisen kemian laboratoriotyöt CHEM-A1310 Biotieteen perusteet CHEM-A1410 Materiaalitieteen perusteet CHEM-C2270 Termodynamiikka CHEM-C2280 Termodynamiikan laboratoriotyöt Jos olet suorittanut esitietovaatimuksena olevat kurssit korvaavilla opinnoilla, mutta ilmoittautuminen on Hylätty- tai Ei täytä vaatimuksia -tilassa, olethan yhteydessä kandiohjelman opintosihteeriin ilmoittautuaksesi.
prerequisites.sv: Obligatoriska förkunskaper: 110 sp studier som hör till kandidatexamen, största delen av grundstudierna och huvudämnestudierna bör vara avlagda. Vid anmälning till seminariet bör följande kurser vara avlagda: CHEM-A1100 Industrins omgivning och dess processer CHEM-A1120 Strömningsteknik och värmeöverföring CHEM-A1270 Allmän kemi CHEM-A1280 Grundläggande laboratoriearbeten i kemi CHEM-A1290 Grundkurs i organisk kemi CHEM-A1205 Laboratoriearbeten i organisk kemi CHEM-A1310 Grunderna i biovetenskap CHEM-A1410 Grunder i materialvetenskap CHEM-C2270 Termodynamik CHEM-C2280 Laboratoriearbeten i termodynamik Om du har avlagt motsvarande förkunskapskurser, vänligen kontakta kandidatprogrammets studiesekreterare för att anmäla dig till seminariet.
prerequisites.en: Compulsory prerequisites: 110 cr as part of the B.Sc. degree, mainly from basic- and major studies. When enrolling to the seminar, the following courses have to be completed: CHEM-A1100 Teollisuuden toimintaympäristö ja prosessit CHEM-A1120 Virtaustekniikka ja lämmönsiirto CHEM-A1270 Yleinen kemia CHEM-A1280 Kemian peruslaboratoriotyöt CHEM-A1290 Orgaanisen kemian peruskurssi CHEM-A1205 Orgaanisen kemian laboratoriotyöt CHEM-A1310 Biotieteen perusteet CHEM-A1410 Materiaalitieteen perusteet CHEM-C2270 Termodynamiikka CHEM-C2280 Termodynamiikan laboratoriotyöt If you have completed an equivalent course instead of the set prerequisite course, please contact the study affairs secretary for the BSc programme to enroll.

learningOutcomes.fi: Opintojakson suoritettuaan opiskelija osaa hakea tieteellistä tietoa ja arvioida sitä kriittisesti, laatia tutkimussuunnitelman ja työstää tieteellistä tietoa tutkimussuunnitelman mukaisesti opinnäytteeksi.
learningOutcomes.sv: Efter godkänd kurs ska den studerande kunna hitta och kritiskt utvärdera vetenskaplig information, utforma en forskningsplan och utarbeta vetenskaplig information till ett lärdomsprov enligt forskningsplanen.
learningOutcomes.en: After the course the student will be able to search for scientific information and evaluate it critically, establish a research plan and process the scientific information into a Bachelor's thesis.

content.fi: Kandidaatinseminaari koostuu luennoista, kandidaatintyöstä ja seminaariesityksestä. Seminaarissa käsitellään tieteellistä ajattelua, tiedonhakua, tiedon jäsentämistä ja käsittelyä sekä kielen ja viestinnän taitoja. Kandidaatintyö laaditaan pääaineen alaan liittyvästä aiheesta, josta ohjaaja ja opiskelija keskenään sopivat kandidaatinseminaarin alussa.
content.sv: Kandidatseminariet består av föreläsningar, ett kandidatarbete och en seminariepresentation. På seminariet behandlas vetenskapligt tänkande, informationssökning, strukturering och behandling av information samt språkliga och kommunikativa färdigheter. Kandidatarbetet ska skrivas inom huvudämnet, handledare och studerande kommer överens om rubriken för arbetet i början av kandidatseminariet.
content.en: Seminar consists of weekly lectures, bachelor's thesis and presentation.

additionalInformation.fi: Opetuskieli: suomi Opetusperiodi: 2024-2025 Syksy I - Kevät V  2025-2026 Syksy I - Kevät V Ilmoittautuminen: Seminaari on tarkoitettu Kemian tekniikka ja prosessit pääaineopiskelijoille.
additionalInformation.sv: Undervisningsspråket: finska Undervisningsperiod: 2024-2025 Höst I - Vår V  2025-2026 Höst I - Vår V Anmälan: Seminariet är avsett för studerande i huvudämnet Kemiteknik och processer.
additionalInformation.en: Teaching Language: Finnish Teaching Period: 2024-2025 Autumn I - Spring V  2025-2026 Autumn I - Spring V Registration: Seminar is offered for Bachelor's students with Chemical Engineering and Processes as their major

assesmentMethods.fi: Kurssi koostuu pakollisesta luentosarjasta ja itsenäisesti tehtävästä kandidaatintyöstä. Arvostelu perustuu kandidaatintyöhön (100 %).

assesmentMethods.en: Course consists of compulsory lectures and Bachelor's thesis which is written independently

Ruotsinkielinen seminaari toimii koulutusohjelmien suomenkielisten seminaarien alaopetustapahtumana. Du får i så fall ämne och handledare via huvudämnets finskspråkiga seminarium och bedömningen av kandidatarbetet går också via huvudämnets ansvarslärare. learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course the student will be able to:
  • Propose plausible reaction mechanisms for organic reactions based on experimental and computational data.
  • Consider selectivity controlling effects in reactions.
  • Design experimental and theoretical mechanistic studies to rule out mechanistic alternatives
learningOutcomes.sv:
After the course the student will be able to:
  • Propose plausible reaction mechanisms for organic reactions based on experimental and computational data.
  • Consider selectivity controlling effects in reactions.
  • Design experimental and theoretical mechanistic studies to rule out mechanistic alternatives
learningOutcomes.en:
After the course the student will be able to:
  • Propose plausible reaction mechanisms for organic reactions based on experimental and computational data.
  • Consider selectivity controlling effects in reactions.
  • Design experimental and theoretical mechanistic studies to rule out mechanistic alternatives

content.fi:
Idealized models for mechanisms: collision theory, Arrhenius plots, rate laws, Hammond's postulate, Curtin–Hammett, linear free energy relationships, energy landscapes, solvent models, catalysis. Experimental methods in physical organic chemistry: labeling, crossover experiments, kinetic isotope effects, competition experiments, and Hammett plots. Theoretical methods in physical organic chemistry: conformer spaces, minimum energy pathways, energy decomposition, Boltzmann-distributions.
The course uses problem-based learning as the main pedagogical approach.

Theoretical methods in physical organic chemistry: conformer spaces, minimum energy pathways, energy decomposition, Boltzmann-distributions.
The course uses problem-based learning as the main pedagogical approach.

Theoretical methods in physical organic chemistry: conformer spaces, minimum energy pathways, energy decomposition, Boltzmann-distributions.

name.en: Forests, Wood and Carbon, Online teaching

workload.fi: The course is mainly based on independent study in the online platform.
workload.sv: The course is mainly based on independent study in the online platform.
workload.en: The course is mainly based on independent study in the online platform.

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: No prerequisites
prerequisites.sv: Recommended prerequisites: No prerequisites
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: No prerequisites

learningOutcomes.fi:
After this course students:
  • are able to describe the role of forests in the carbon cycle and the potential of wood products as carbon storage
  • are able to differentiate the main forest operation methods and material flows in the forest bioeconomy
  • are able to list the common work phases of life-cycle analysis
  • know how to calculate carbon storage potential of wood
  • know the basic macro-level structure of wood and are able to describe the basics of wood grain orientation
  • are able to describe how moisture influences wood dimensional changes and strength and are able to explain these phenomena based on cell-level interaction
  • know the influence of grain angle, knots and other natural features of wood on its movement, appearance, and mechanical properties
  • are able to describe the most common wood products and their typical applications

  • are able to describe how moisture influences wood dimensional changes and strength and are able to explain these phenomena based on cell-level interaction
  • know the influence of grain angle, knots and other natural features of wood on its movement, appearance, and mechanical properties
  • are able to describe the most common wood products and their typical applications

After this course students:
  • are able to describe the role of forests in the carbon cycle and the potential of wood products as carbon storage
  • are able to differentiate the main forest operation methods and material flows in the forest bioeconomy
  • are able to list the common work phases of life-cycle analysis
  • know how to calculate carbon storage potential of wood
  • know the basic macro-level structure of wood and are able to describe the basics of wood grain orientation
  • are able to describe how moisture influences wood dimensional changes and strength and are able to explain these phenomena based on cell-level interaction
  • know the influence of grain angle, knots and other natural features of wood on its movement, appearance, and mechanical properties
  • are able to describe the most common wood products and their typical applications

content.fi: Students on this course will learn about global carbon sources and sinks and the role of forests in the carbon cycle. This course introduces students to the different uses of forests and the raw material flows in the bioeconomy, as well as the potential of wood products in carbon storage. The general rules of life-cycle analysis are introduced, including selected work phases, such as calculating carbon storage potential in the case of wood. Students are introduced to the basic principles of sustainable forestry and circular bioeconomy, with wood as an example. The basic structure of wood is presented with links to its properties such as appearance, dimensional stability, and strength. Students will learn about the mechanical properties of wood as well its dimensional stability and moisture interaction at the cell-level. Students will become familiar with the most common long-lived wood products that are used in various applications in the built environment.

learningOutcomes.fi: After the course the student will (i) be familiar with and inspired by lignocellulosic biomaterials, including cellulose fibers, micro- and nanofibrillar cellulose, cellulose derivatives, lignin, bark extractives and novel combinations of these, (ii) understand the basics of material sustainability, (iii) know basic methods and safety rules in explorative bio-based material research (iv) have experience on interdisciplinary working environment in practice and (v) is able to plan and implement an indipendent ChemArts project.
learningOutcomes.sv: After the course the student will (i) be familiar with and inspired by lignocellulosic biomaterials, including cellulose fibers, micro- and nanofibrillar cellulose, cellulose derivatives, lignin, bark extractives and novel combinations of these, (ii) understand the basics of material sustainability, (iii) know basic methods and safety rules in explorative bio-based material research (iv) have experience on interdisciplinary working environment in practice and (v) is able to plan and implement an indipendent ChemArts project.
learningOutcomes.en: After the course the student will (i) be familiar with and inspired by lignocellulosic biomaterials, including cellulose fibers, micro- and nanofibrillar cellulose, cellulose derivatives, lignin, bark extractives and novel combinations of these, (ii) understand the basics of material sustainability, (iii) know basic methods and safety rules in explorative bio-based material research (iv) have experience on interdisciplinary working environment in practice and (v) is able to plan and implement an indipendent ChemArts project.

content.fi: The course consists of introductory lectures, hands-on assignments at the laboratory, and final presentation of the experiments. Lectures are focusing on bio-based materials, material research and design. Assignments and seminar presentation will be conducted in groups.

organizationName.en: Department of Design

name.sv: Industrins omgivning och dess processer, Tentamen
name.en: Industrial Environment and its Processes, Exam

workload.fi:
5 op = 135 h
Luennot 36 h, harjoitukset 24 h
Quiz-kysymykset, muu oma opiskelu, välikokeet/tentti 75 h
workload.sv:
5 sp = 135 h
föreläsningar 36 h, övningar 24 h
Quiz-frågor, självständigt arbete, prov/tentamen 75 h
workload.en:
5 cr = 135 h
lectures 36 h, exercises 24 h
Quizzes, independent work, exams 75 h

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin jälkeen opiskelija
- ymmärtää liiketoiminnan, tuotannonsuunnittelun ja tuotekehityksen vaikutuksia ympäristöön, yhteiskuntaan ja talouteen
- ymmärtää prosessiteollisuuden toimialaa ja toimintaympäristöä
- osaa hyödyntää kemiantekniikan peruslaskentamalleja
- osaa selittää prosessitekniikan suomenkielisiä peruskäsitteitä ja kuvata yleisimpien yksikköprosessien toimintaa käyttäen myös luonnontieteellistä käsitteistöä ja teknisen prosessihallinnan periaatteita sekä tulkita prosessikaavioita
- osaa muodostaa ja laskea prosessien aine- ja energiataseita
learningOutcomes.sv:
Efter kursen ska studeranden kunna:
-förstå vad som menas med processindustrins bransch och verksamhetområde
-utnyttja kemiteknikens grundräknemodeller
-förklara de grundläggande begreppen i processteknik och beskriva de vanligaste operationerna i enhetsprocesser genom att använda naturvetenskapliga begrepp och principer i förvaltning av tekniska processer
- formulera balansekvationer och tolka och använda enkla analytiska material- och energibalanser samt förstå balansberäkningar för produktionsekonomi
-klassificera på principnivå  naturresurser ur den hållbara utvecklingens synvinkel
learningOutcomes.en:
Kurssin jälkeen opiskelija
- ymmärtää liiketoiminnan, tuotannonsuunnittelun ja tuotekehityksen vaikutuksia ympäristöön, yhteiskuntaan ja talouteen
- ymmärtää prosessiteollisuuden toimialaa ja toimintaympäristöä
- osaa hyödyntää kemiantekniikan peruslaskentamalleja
- osaa selittää prosessitekniikan suomenkielisiä peruskäsitteitä ja kuvata yleisimpien yksikköprosessien toimintaa käyttäen myös luonnontieteellistä käsitteistöä ja teknisen prosessihallinnan periaatteita sekä tulkita prosessikaavioita
- osaa muodostaa ja laskea prosessien aine- ja energiataseita

content.fi: Teollinen toimintaympäristö, raaka-aineista lopputuotteisiin, kestävä kehitys, ympäristönsuojelun ohjaus, tuotanto- ja erotusprosessit. Johdanto kemiantekniikan laskennan perusteisiin, aine- ja energiataseet.
content.sv: Industriell verksamhetsmiljö, från råvaror till färdiga produkter, hållbar utveckling, produktions- och separationsprocesser. Introduktion till grunderna i kemitekniska beräkningar, material- och energibalanser.
content.en: Teollinen toimintaympäristö, raaka-aineista lopputuotteisiin, kestävä kehitys, ympäristönsuojelun ohjaus, tuotanto- ja erotusprosessit. Johdanto kemiantekniikan laskennan perusteisiin, aine- ja energiataseet.

assesmentMethods.fi: Quiz-kysymykset ja välikokeet/tentti. Arvosana määräytyy välikokeiden tai tentin sekä quiz-tehtävien perusteella.
assesmentMethods.sv: Quiz-frågor och mellanförhör/tent. Vitsordet baseras på mellanförhören eller tenten samt quiz-frågorna.
assesmentMethods.en: Quizzes and mid-term exams / exam. Grade will be based upon personal the quizzes answers and mid-term exams or exams.

name.sv: Industrins omgivning och dess processer, Föreläsning
name.en: Industrial Environment and its Processes, Lecture

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin jälkeen opiskelija
- ymmärtää liiketoiminnan, tuotannonsuunnittelun ja tuotekehityksen vaikutuksia ympäristöön, yhteiskuntaan ja talouteen
- ymmärtää prosessiteollisuuden toimialaa ja toimintaympäristöä
- osaa hyödyntää kemiantekniikan peruslaskentamalleja
- osaa selittää prosessitekniikan suomenkielisiä peruskäsitteitä ja kuvata yleisimpien yksikköprosessien toimintaa käyttäen myös luonnontieteellistä käsitteistöä ja teknisen prosessihallinnan periaatteita sekä tulkita prosessikaavioita
- osaa muodostaa ja laskea prosessien aine- ja energiataseita
learningOutcomes.sv:
Efter kursen ska studeranden kunna:
-förstå vad som menas med processindustrins bransch och verksamhetområde
-utnyttja kemiteknikens grundräknemodeller
-förklara de grundläggande begreppen i processteknik och beskriva de vanligaste operationerna i enhetsprocesser genom att använda naturvetenskapliga begrepp och principer i förvaltning av tekniska processer
- formulera balansekvationer och tolka och använda enkla analytiska material- och energibalanser samt förstå balansberäkningar för produktionsekonomi
-klassificera på principnivå  naturresurser ur den hållbara utvecklingens synvinkel
learningOutcomes.en:
Kurssin jälkeen opiskelija
- ymmärtää liiketoiminnan, tuotannonsuunnittelun ja tuotekehityksen vaikutuksia ympäristöön, yhteiskuntaan ja talouteen
- ymmärtää prosessiteollisuuden toimialaa ja toimintaympäristöä
- osaa hyödyntää kemiantekniikan peruslaskentamalleja
- osaa selittää prosessitekniikan suomenkielisiä peruskäsitteitä ja kuvata yleisimpien yksikköprosessien toimintaa käyttäen myös luonnontieteellistä käsitteistöä ja teknisen prosessihallinnan periaatteita sekä tulkita prosessikaavioita
- osaa muodostaa ja laskea prosessien aine- ja energiataseita

content.fi: Teollinen toimintaympäristö, raaka-aineista lopputuotteisiin, kestävä kehitys, ympäristönsuojelun ohjaus, tuotanto- ja erotusprosessit. Johdanto kemiantekniikan laskennan perusteisiin, aine- ja energiataseet.
content.sv: Industriell verksamhetsmiljö, från råvaror till färdiga produkter, hållbar utveckling, produktions- och separationsprocesser. Introduktion till grunderna i kemitekniska beräkningar, material- och energibalanser.
content.en: Teollinen toimintaympäristö, raaka-aineista lopputuotteisiin, kestävä kehitys, ympäristönsuojelun ohjaus, tuotanto- ja erotusprosessit. Johdanto kemiantekniikan laskennan perusteisiin, aine- ja energiataseet.

assesmentMethods.fi: Quiz-kysymykset ja välikokeet/tentti. Arvosana määräytyy välikokeiden tai tentin sekä quiz-tehtävien perusteella.
assesmentMethods.sv: Quiz-frågor och mellanförhör/tent. Vitsordet baseras på mellanförhören eller tenten samt quiz-frågorna.
assesmentMethods.en: Quizzes and mid-term exams / exam. Grade will be based upon personal the quizzes answers and mid-term exams or exams.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course the student will be able to
  • understand the entropy and thermodynamical potentials, like enthalpy and free energy
  • understand the thermodynamical efficiency of heat engines
  • calculate the thermodynamic quantities of chemical reactions and to explain the chemical equilibria using them
  • understand the phase equilibria of pure substances and to interpret simple phase diagrams
  • understand the ideal and non-ideal solutions
  • understand chemical kinetics of simple reactions and to solve the reaction rate law from elementary reactions

  • understand the thermodynamical efficiency of heat engines
  • calculate the thermodynamic quantities of chemical reactions and to explain the chemical equilibria using them
  • understand the phase equilibria of pure substances and to interpret simple phase diagrams
  • understand the ideal and non-ideal solutions
  • understand chemical kinetics of simple reactions and to solve the reaction rate law from elementary reactions

content.fi: Thermodynamical quantities, chemical and electrochemical equilibria. Phase equilibria of pure substances. Phase equilibria of ideal and real mixtures. Simple phase diagrams. Multi-step chemical reactions and their kinetics, biokinetics. Surface chemistry, surface tension, adsorption on surfaces.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin jälkeen opiskelija: - tuntee yleisimmät erotusoperaatiot ja osaa valita erotusmenetelmän tarpeen perusteella
- osaa tulkita faasitasapainoa kuvaavia diagrammeja sekä valita faasitasapainomalleja ja ratkaista niitä sopivilla ohjelmistoilla
- tuntee prosessisimulaattoreiden toimintaperiaatteen ja osaa ratkaista yksinkertaisten prosessien aineja energiataseita niiden perusteella, asettaa spesifikaatioita ja optimoida prosesseja
- osaa etsiä ja käyttää empiirisiä korrelaatiota aineominaisuuksien ja prosessien malliparametrien estimoimiseen
- ymmärtää kemiallisten teollisten prosessien mekanistisen mallituksen periaatteet ja osaa muodostaa yksinkertaisia prosessimalleja sekä ratkaista niitä
- osaa joidenkin erotusoperaatioiden perusmitoituksen.
learningOutcomes.sv:
Efter kursen :
- känner studeranden till de vanligaste enhetsoperationerna och kan välja enligt behov den rätta
- kan studeranden tolka fasdiagram som representerar jämvikt mellan olika faser och kan välja och lösa problem med lämpliga simuleringsprogram 
- känner studeranden till funktionsprincipen av process simuleringsprogram och kan lösa  enkla mass- och energibalanser med dem, ställa specifikationer och optimera processer 
- kan studeranden finna och tillämpa empiriska korrelationer för att estimera fysikaliska egenskaper och använda dem som modellparametrar
- förstår studeranden principerna av den mekanistiska modelleringen av industriella processer och kan skapa enkla processmodeller och lösa problem med dem
- kan studeranden grunden av dimensionering av några enhetsoperationer
learningOutcomes.en:
After the course the student:
- knows the most common unit operations and is able to select proper method based on the need
- is able to interpret phase equilibrium diagrams and is able to choose models to describe the phase equilibrium. Can solve phase equilibria problems with suitable software
- knows the operating principle of process simulators and is able to solve mass and energy balances with these, set specifications and optimize processes
- is able to look for and apply empirical correlations for estimation of physical properties and use these as model parameters in modelling of processes
- understands the mechanistic modelling of industrial chemical processes and is able to form simple process models and solve them
- is able to dimension some unit operations at basic level

content.fi: - Erotusoperaatiot- Mekanistinen kemiallisten prosessien mallitus- Prosessisimulaattoreiden käyttö- Johdanto kemian teollisuuden prosessien ja laitteiden suunnitteluun- Teollisia esimerkkejä
content.sv:
Innehål:
- Enhetsoperationer
- Mekanistisk modellering av kemiska processer
- Användning av process simulationsprogram
- Inledning till planering av industriella processer och apparater
- Industriella exempel
content.en:
Contents:
- Unit operations
- Mechanistic modelling of chemical processes
- The use of process simulators
- Introduction to the design of processes and equipment in chemical industry
- Industrial examples

sekä tentti. Tentti sisältää teoria ja laskuosuuden.

assesmentMethods.en: Theory, learning diary, exercises, two home works in small groups and an exam. Exam includes calculation and theory part.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After completing the course student can:
  • recognize the role of metals in the modern society
  • understand the role and impact of metals in the climate- and eco-systems
  • recognize the local and global state of the metals resources
  • knowing the main metals production and their global economics
learningOutcomes.sv:
After completing the course student can:
  • recognize the role of metals in the modern society
  • understand the role and impact of metals in the climate- and eco-systems
  • recognize the local and global state of the metals resources
  • knowing the main metals production and their global economics
learningOutcomes.en:
After completing the course student can:
  • recognize the role of metals in the modern society
  • understand the role and impact of metals in the climate- and eco-systems
  • recognize the local and global state of the metals resources
  • knowing the main metals production and their global economics

content.fi:
The course is organized entirely online. The course content is divided into six themes.Theme 1: Where and how are metals used?
  • Role of metals in the history of humankind
  • Evolution of metals applications
  • Metals in modern society and green transition
  • Different types of metals and their selected applications
Theme 2: Why are metals used in so many applications?
  • Common properties of metals
  • Properties of ferrous metals and steel
  • Properties of nonferrous and precious metals
  • Metals as Critical Raw Materials
Theme 3: How are metals produced?
  • The value chain of metals from mining to refining
  • Different types of raw materials
  • The role of minerals processing and its principles
  • Introduction to pyrometallurgy and hydrometallurgy
Theme 4: Why are metals so critical now?
  • Concepts of circular economy and sustainability
  • Connection between metals and sustainability
  • Metals for energy production and storage
Theme 5: Can we reuse metals?
  • Circular economy of metals
  • Possible routes of metal recycling
  • Challenges related to metal recycling and resource efficiency
  • Newest trends in metal recycling technologies
Theme 6: How to assess environmental impact of metals?
  • Importance of environmental impacts assessment
  • Different categories of environmental impacts
  • Life Cycle Assessment as a tool for evaluating environmental impacts
  • Example of Life Cycle Assessment analysis of metals production
content.sv:
What are metals and what are their roles in society?
  • Different kinds of metals and their main properties
  • Metals in society
    • How is the basic metal structure and how does it link to its properties?
      • Macro-level structure of metals (crystal structure, alloying)
      • Example links between structure and properties (strength, hardness, yield, etc.)
      • Peek at inspiring properties: antibacterial properties, aesthetic/artistic properties, acoustic properties (instruments), extreme use cases
    • The fundamental role of metals in the circular economy
    • Metals in Energy production and storage
    • Global primary and secondary raw materials for metals
    • World needs metals
How are metals produced?
  • Basics of minerals processing
  • Basic methods for metals production from mineral raw materials
  • Recycling of metals
  • Life-cycle analysis for metal products (examples, comparison, carbon footprint and handprint)
  What are the basic metal products and their applications?
  • Very briefly with inspiring applications: metals and alloys
  • Historical metal uses
  • Modern metal uses: batteries, smart phones, EVs, medicine etc.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After completing the course student can:
  • recognize the role of metals in the modern society
  • understand the role and impact of metals in the climate- and eco-systems
  • recognize the local and global state of the metals resources
  • knowing the main metals production and their global economics
learningOutcomes.sv:
After completing the course student can:
  • recognize the role of metals in the modern society
  • understand the role and impact of metals in the climate- and eco-systems
  • recognize the local and global state of the metals resources
  • knowing the main metals production and their global economics
learningOutcomes.en:
After completing the course student can:
  • recognize the role of metals in the modern society
  • understand the role and impact of metals in the climate- and eco-systems
  • recognize the local and global state of the metals resources
  • knowing the main metals production and their global economics

content.fi:
The course is organized entirely online. The course content is divided into six themes.Theme 1: Where and how are metals used?
  • Role of metals in the history of humankind
  • Evolution of metals applications
  • Metals in modern society and green transition
  • Different types of metals and their selected applications
Theme 2: Why are metals used in so many applications?
  • Common properties of metals
  • Properties of ferrous metals and steel
  • Properties of nonferrous and precious metals
  • Metals as Critical Raw Materials
Theme 3: How are metals produced?
  • The value chain of metals from mining to refining
  • Different types of raw materials
  • The role of minerals processing and its principles
  • Introduction to pyrometallurgy and hydrometallurgy
Theme 4: Why are metals so critical now?
  • Concepts of circular economy and sustainability
  • Connection between metals and sustainability
  • Metals for energy production and storage
Theme 5: Can we reuse metals?
  • Circular economy of metals
  • Possible routes of metal recycling
  • Challenges related to metal recycling and resource efficiency
  • Newest trends in metal recycling technologies
Theme 6: How to assess environmental impact of metals?
  • Importance of environmental impacts assessment
  • Different categories of environmental impacts
  • Life Cycle Assessment as a tool for evaluating environmental impacts
  • Example of Life Cycle Assessment analysis of metals production
content.sv:
What are metals and what are their roles in society?
  • Different kinds of metals and their main properties
  • Metals in society
    • How is the basic metal structure and how does it link to its properties?
      • Macro-level structure of metals (crystal structure, alloying)
      • Example links between structure and properties (strength, hardness, yield, etc.)
      • Peek at inspiring properties: antibacterial properties, aesthetic/artistic properties, acoustic properties (instruments), extreme use cases
    • The fundamental role of metals in the circular economy
    • Metals in Energy production and storage
    • Global primary and secondary raw materials for metals
    • World needs metals
How are metals produced?
  • Basics of minerals processing
  • Basic methods for metals production from mineral raw materials
  • Recycling of metals
  • Life-cycle analysis for metal products (examples, comparison, carbon footprint and handprint)
  What are the basic metal products and their applications?
  • Very briefly with inspiring applications: metals and alloys
  • Historical metal uses
  • Modern metal uses: batteries, smart phones, EVs, medicine etc.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course the student
1. Has gained hands-on experience on basic principles of nanochemistry 
2. Has an overview of synthesis techniques of advanced nanomaterials 
3. is able to analyze physical property relations in functional nanomaterials
4. is able to apply methods/approaches/ideas from scientific papers to own study topics related to materials nanochemistry

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course, student will be able to

  • document data and observations from laboratory experiments into a structured lab journal
  • process lab data into analytically meaningful results
  • discuss and analyse the results in written report, according to scientific and engineering practices

learningOutcomes.fi:
The student knows atomic and nanoscale phenomena that affect chemical, mechanical, optical, biological and fluidic surface properties.
The student can explain most important surface modification and coating methods.
The student can analyze and apply major thin film deposition processes: PVD, CVD, ALD.
The student is aware of surface non-idealities, roughness, contamination and chemical heterogeneity.
The student can critically read original scientific literature on the topical area of surfaces and films.
learningOutcomes.sv:
The student knows atomic and nanoscale phenomena that affect chemical, mechanical, optical, biological and fluidic surface properties.
The student can explain most important surface modification and coating methods.
The student can analyze and apply major thin film deposition processes: PVD, CVD, ALD.
The student is aware of surface non-idealities, roughness, contamination and chemical heterogeneity.
The student can critically read original scientific literature on the topical area of surfaces and films.
learningOutcomes.en:
The student knows atomic and nanoscale phenomena that affect chemical, mechanical, optical, biological and fluidic surface properties.
The student can explain most important surface modification and coating methods.
The student can analyze and apply major thin film deposition processes: PVD, CVD, ALD.
The student is aware of surface non-idealities, roughness, contamination and chemical heterogeneity.
The student can critically read original scientific literature on the topical area of surfaces and films.

content.fi:
Intro: physical, chemical, mechanical, optical, fluidic and biological processes on surfaces.
Ideal surfaces, vacuum, gas-solid, contamination. Real surfaces, metals, glass, silicon, polymers, native oxides. Surface treatments: cleaning, activation, passivation. Wetting and superhydrophobicity. ALD & MLD, CVD, epitaxy, nanolaminates. Adsorption, biomolecules on surfaces, biocompatibility. Adhesion, bonding, gekko. Surface degradation (friction, lubrication, abrasion, erosion, corrosion). Thin films for energy technology.

Surface degradation (friction, lubrication, abrasion, erosion, corrosion). Thin films for energy technology.

workload.fi: 5 op = 135 hLuennot, kotitehtävät, seminaariesitys, itsenäinen opiskelu, tentti.
workload.sv: 5 sp = 135 hFöreläsningar, hemuppgifter, seminariepresentation, självständigt arbete, examen.
workload.en: 5 cr = 135 hLectures, homework, seminar presentation, independent studying, exam.

prerequisites.fi: Pakolliset esitiedot: Pakolliset esitiedot: CHEM-A1200 tai CHEM-A1270 tai CHEM-C1220.
prerequisites.sv: Obligatoriska förkunskaper: Obligatoriska förhandskunkaper: CHEM-A1200 eller CHEM-A1270 eller CHEM-C1220.
prerequisites.en: Compulsory prerequisites: Compulsory prerequisites: CHEM-A1200 or CHEM-A1270 or CHEM-C1220.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin suoritettuaan opiskelija osaa: - selittää elektronirakenteen merkityksen alkuaineiden ominaisuuksiin ja reaktiivisuuteen
- kuvata tärkeimpien epäorgaanisten yhdisteiden ominaisuuksia ja käyttökohteita
- kuvata epäorgaanisten materiaalien tärkeimpiä kiderakenteita ja käyttää VESTA-ohjelmaa rakenteiden tarkastelussa
- laatia ja pitää seminaariesityksen
learningOutcomes.sv:
Efter godkänd kurs ska studenten kunna:
- förklara elektronkonfigurationens betydelse för egenskaper och reaktivitet hos grundämnena- beskriva egenskaper och tillämpningar hos de viktigaste oorganiska föreningarna- beskriva de viktigaste kristallstrukturerna hos oorganiska material och använda VESTA-programmet för att granska strukturerna- förbereda och hålla en seminariepresentation
learningOutcomes.en:
After the course the student will be able to:
- describe the connection between electron structures of the elements and their properties and reactivity- describe the properties and applications of the most important inorganic compounds- describe the crystal structures of the most important inorganic materials and use the VESTA program to examine the structures- prepare and give a seminar presentation

content.fi: - alkuaineiden kemian pääpiirteet- kemiallinen sitoutuminen- tärkeimpien epäorgaanisten yhdisteiden ominaisuudet- kiinteän olomuodon tärkeimmät rakennetyypit- epäorgaanisten materiaalien yleisimmät karakterisointimenetelmät
content.sv: - huvuddrag i grundämnenas kemi- kemisk bindning- de viktigaste egenskaperna hos oorganiska föreningar- de viktigaste kristallstrukturerna i fast tillstånd- de vanligaste karakteriseringsmetoderna för oorganiska material
content.en: - main features of the chemistry of the elements- chemical bonding- properties of the most important inorganic compounds- the most important solid state structures- the general characterization methods of inorganic materials

prerequisites.fi: Pakolliset esitiedot: Pakolliset esitiedot: CHEM-A1200 tai CHEM-A1270 tai CHEM-C1220.
prerequisites.sv: Obligatoriska förkunskaper: Obligatoriska förhandskunkaper: CHEM-A1200 eller CHEM-A1270 eller CHEM-C1220.
prerequisites.en: Compulsory prerequisites: Compulsory prerequisites: CHEM-A1200 or CHEM-A1270 or CHEM-C1220.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin suoritettuaan opiskelija osaa: - selittää elektronirakenteen merkityksen alkuaineiden ominaisuuksiin ja reaktiivisuuteen
- kuvata tärkeimpien epäorgaanisten yhdisteiden ominaisuuksia ja käyttökohteita
- kuvata epäorgaanisten materiaalien tärkeimpiä kiderakenteita ja käyttää VESTA-ohjelmaa rakenteiden tarkastelussa
- laatia ja pitää seminaariesityksen
learningOutcomes.sv:
Efter godkänd kurs ska studenten kunna:
- förklara elektronkonfigurationens betydelse för egenskaper och reaktivitet hos grundämnena- beskriva egenskaper och tillämpningar hos de viktigaste oorganiska föreningarna- beskriva de viktigaste kristallstrukturerna hos oorganiska material och använda VESTA-programmet för att granska strukturerna- förbereda och hålla en seminariepresentation
learningOutcomes.en:
After the course the student will be able to:
- describe the connection between electron structures of the elements and their properties and reactivity- describe the properties and applications of the most important inorganic compounds- describe the crystal structures of the most important inorganic materials and use the VESTA program to examine the structures- prepare and give a seminar presentation

content.fi: - alkuaineiden kemian pääpiirteet- kemiallinen sitoutuminen- tärkeimpien epäorgaanisten yhdisteiden ominaisuudet- kiinteän olomuodon tärkeimmät rakennetyypit- epäorgaanisten materiaalien yleisimmät karakterisointimenetelmät
content.sv: - huvuddrag i grundämnenas kemi- kemisk bindning- de viktigaste egenskaperna hos oorganiska föreningar- de viktigaste kristallstrukturerna i fast tillstånd- de vanligaste karakteriseringsmetoderna för oorganiska material
content.en: - main features of the chemistry of the elements- chemical bonding- properties of the most important inorganic compounds- the most important solid state structures- the general characterization methods of inorganic materials

prerequisites.fi: Suositellut esitiedot: CHEM-A1270 Yleinen kemia TAI CHEM-A1200 Kemiallinen rakenne ja sitoutuminen TAI CHEM-A1211 Principles of General Chemistry
prerequisites.sv: Rekommenderade förkunskaper: CHEM-A1270 Allmän kemi ELLER CHEM-A1200 Kemisk struktur och bindning ELLER CHEM-A1211 Principles of General Chemistry
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: CHEM-A1270 General Chemistry OR CHEM-A1200 Chemical structure and bonding OR CHEM-A1211 Principles of General Chemistry

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin jälkeen opiskelija
  • Ymmärtää ja osaa selittää orgaanisten molekyylien rakenteen ja reaktiivisuuden molekyyliorbitaaliteorian avulla.
  • Osaa päätellä ja esittää reaktiomekanismeja yksinkertaisille kemiallisille reaktioille kaarinuolien ja molekyyliorbitaalien avulla.
  • Osaa esittää orgaanisia rakenteita ja reaktioita käsin piirtäen sekä käyttäen ChemDraw-ohjelmistoa.
  • Hallitsee molekyylien stereokemian ja osaa hyödyntää molekyylimalleja.
  • Kehittää ongelmanratkaisutaitoja pienryhmissä.
learningOutcomes.sv:
Efter gudkänd kurs kan studenten:
  • Förstå och förklara strukturer samt reaktivitet hos organiska molekyler med hjälp av molekylär orbitalteori.
  • Kan rita "curved arrow" mekanismer för enkla organiska reaktioner med hjälp av molekylära orbitaler.
  • Kan presentera organiska strukturer och reaktioner både med ChemDraw och för hand.
  • Förstår molekylär stereokemi och kan använda molekylära modeller.
  • Kan samarbeta och lösa problem i grupp.
learningOutcomes.en:
After the course the student
  • Understands and is able to explain structures and reactivities of organic molecules using molecular orbital theory.
  • Is able to deduce and draw curved arrow mechanisms for reasonably simple organic reactions with the help of molecular orbitals.
  • Is able to represent organic structures and reactions both with ChemDraw and drawing by hand.
  • Understands molecular stereochemistry and can utilize molecular models.
  • Work collaborative to solve problems.

content.fi:
Pääsisältö:
  • Molekyylien rakenne, konformaatiot, stereokemia, molekyylimallit.
  • Atomiorbitaalit, atomiorbitaalien lineaarikombinaatiot, hybridisaatio, valenssisidosteoria, molekyyliorbitaalit, rintamaorbitaalit.
  • Kaarinuolimekanismien päättely ja piirtäminen.
  • Happo-emäskemia ja pKa.
  • Karbonyylikemia: additiot, substituutiot ja enolaatit.
  • Substituutiot ja eliminaatiot.
Lisätiedot:
  • Termodynaaminen ja kineettinen kontrolli.
  • Reaktiivisuusmallien tunnistaminen.
  • Rakenne-aktiivisuusmallit: Molekyylien rakenteen vaikutus reaktiivisuuteen.
  • Loogisten ongelmanratkaisutaitojen kehittäminen.
Kiva tietää:
  • Orgaanisen kemian merkitys kiertotaloudessa, kemiallisessa biologiassa, nanoteknologiassa ja materiaalitieteessä.
content.sv:
Huvudinnehåll:
  • Struktur, modell, konformation och stereokemi för organiska molekyler.
  • Atomorbitaler (AO), molekylorbitaler (MO), linjär kombination av atomorbitaler (LCAO), hybridisering, valensbindningsteori (VB), molekylorbitaler (MO) och "frontier" molekylorbitaler (FMO).
  • Ritning av "curved arrow" mekanismer för organiska reaktioner.
  • Syra-baskemi och pKa.
  • Karbonylkemi: additioner, substitutioner samt enolater.
  • Substiution- och eliminationreaktioner.
Tilläggsinformation:
  • Termodynamisk och kinetisk kontroll.
  • Reaktivitetmodeller hos organiska molekyler.
  • Struktur-reaktivitetstränder: Hur molekylär struktur definierar kemisk reaktivitet.
  • Metoder för att logiskt kunna lösa komplexa problem.
Bra att veta:
  • Hållbarhet, kemisk biologi, molekylär nankoteknologi och materialvetenskap med fokus på organisk kemi.
content.en:
Must know:
  • Molecular structure, conformations, stereochemistry, molecular models.
  • Atomic orbitals (AO), linear combination of atomic orbitals (LCAO), hybridization, valence bond theory (VB), molecular orbitals (MO) and frontier molecular orbitals (FMO).
  • Drawing plausible curved arrow mechanisms for organic reactions.
  • Acid-base chemistry: pKa.
  • Carbonyl chemistry: additions, substitutions, enolates.
  • Substitution and elimination reactions.
Should know:
  • Thermodynamic and kinetic control.
  • Recognizing reactivity patterns in organic molecules.
  • Structure-reactivity patterns: How molecular structure defines chemical reactivity.
  • Approaches for logically solving complex problems.
Nice to know:
  • Relevance of organic chemistry to sustainability, chemical biology, molecular nanotechnology, materials science and more.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin suorittamisen jälkeen opiskelija:
  • Ymmärtää, miten klassinen fysiikka kytkeytyy kemian tekniikan eri osa-alueisiin.
  • Osaa ratkaista klassisen fysiikan ongelmia matemaattisesti.
  • Osaa soveltaa Newtonin liikelakeja ja energian säilymislakeja.
  • Tuntee värähdysliikkeeseen, aaltoliikkeeseen, sähkövarauksiin ja sähkömagnetismiin liittyvät perusilmiöt, ja ymmärtää niiden merkityksen kemian tekniikan eri osa-alueilla.
learningOutcomes.sv:
Efter kursen studeranden:
  • Förstår hur klassisk fysik är kopplad till olika delområden inom kemiteknik.
  • Kan lösa problem inom klassisk fysik matematiskt.
  • Kan tillämpa Newtons rörelselagar och konserveringslagar.
  • Förstår de grundläggande fenomenen svängningar, vågor, elektriska laddningar och elektromagnetism, och deras relevans för olika delområden inom kemiteknik.
learningOutcomes.en:
After completing the course, the student:
  • Understands how classical physics is linked to different subfields of chemical engineering.
  • Is able to solve problems in classical physics mathematically.
  • Can apply Newton's laws of motion and conservation laws.
  • Understands the basic phenomena of oscillations, waves, electric charges, and electromagnetism, and their relevance to different subfields of chemical engineering.

content.fi:
• Klassisen fysiikan matemaattiset perustyökalut kuten vektorilaskenta.
  • Newtonin liikelait
  • Työ, teho ja energia, liike-energia, potentiaalienergia ja säilymislait.
  • Liikemäärä ja erilaiset törmäykset.
  • Värähdysliike, aaltoliike, interferenssi ja diffraktio.
  • Sähkövaraus, Coulombin laki, sähkömagnetismin perusteet ja tasavirtapiirit.
content.sv:
• Grundläggande matematiska verktyg som behövs i klassisk fysik, t.ex. vektoralgebra.
  • Newtons rörelselagar
  • Arbete, effekt och energi, kinetisk energi, potentiell energi och bevarandelagar.
  • Rörelsemängd och olika kollisioner.
  • Oscillationer, vågor, interferens och diffraktion.
  • Elektrisk laddning, Coulombs lag, grunderna i elektromagnetism och likströmskretsar.
content.en:
• Basic mathemathical tools needed in classical physics, for example vector algebra.
  • Newton's laws of motion.
  • Work, power, and energy, kinetic energy, potential energy, and conservation laws.
  • Linear momentum, and different collisions.
  • Oscillations, waves, interference, and diffraction.
  • Electric charge, Coulomb's Law, basics of electromagnetism, and direct-current circuits.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin jälkeen opiskelija osaa - tunnistaa reaktiotekniikan peruskäsitteet
- mitoittaa isotermisiä ideaalireaktoreita
- muodostaa reaktionopeusyhtälöitä annettujen reaktiomekanismien perusteella, määrittää niiden parametreja koetuloksista ja soveltaa niitä reaktoreiden suunnittelussa
- laskea kemiallisen tasapainon ja lämpötilan vaikutuksen reaktioihin
- laskea ja arvioida kemiallisten prosessien toimintaa taseiden avulla.
learningOutcomes.sv:
Efter kursen kan studenten
- känna grundbegreppen i reaktionsteknik- dimensionera isotermiska ideala reaktorer- utforma enkla reaktionshastighetsekvationer för givna reaktionsmekanismer, bestämma hastighetskonstanter på basen av experimentella resultaten och utnyttja hastighetsekvationer i design av kemiska reaktorer- känna till inverkan av kemisk jämvikt och temperatur på reaktioner samt dimensionering av reaktorer, och utforma enkla hastighetsekvationer för jämviktstreaktioner- kan använda balanser för att räkna och undersöka processer
learningOutcomes.en:
After the course the student
- knows basic terms in reaction engineering- is able to design an isothermal ideal reactor- is able to derive a simple rate equation based on given reaction mechanisms, determine rate constants using experimental data and apply the rate equation in the design of reactors- knows the effect of chemical equilibrium and temperature on reactions and reactor design and is able to derive simple rate equations for equilibrium reactions- can use balances to calculate and evaluate processes

content.fi: - kemiallisen reaktiotekniikan perusteet- ideaalireaktorit- reaktionopeus ja kinetiikka- reaktoreiden aine- ja energiataseet
content.sv: - grunder i reaktionsteknik- ideala reaktorer- reaktionshastighet och kemisk kinetik- ämnes- och energibalanser i reaktorer
content.en: - basics of chemical reaction engineering- ideal reactors- reaction rate and chemical kinetics- mass and energy balances of reactors

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin jälkeen opiskelija: - tuntee materiaalien valmistuksen yksikköoperaatiot ja -prosessit
- tuntee keskeisimmät materiaalien tuotantoprosesseihin vaikuttavat ilmiöt ja niiden nopeuksiin vaikuttavat luonnonlait
- osaa käyttää perustekniikoita tyypillisten materiaalitekniikan valmistus/tuotantoprosessien simuloimiseen tasapainotilassa
- tuntee faasitasapainojen (kemian) vaikutuksen prosesseihin ja tuoteominaisuuksiin.

learningOutcomes.en: After completing the course the student: - knows the unit operations and processes in materials production- knows the most important phenomena affecting production processes of materials and the main natural laws affecting them- is able to utilize basic technics in simulating typical processes in material processing at the equilibrium state- knows the effect of phase equilibrium to processes and product properties

learningOutcomes.fi:
Understand basic concepts around sustainability in the bioproducts industry
Frame sustainability from technology and value chain perspective​s
Learn from applied examples about different methods for analyzing the sustainability of bioproduct production pathways
Build skills for creating evidence-based critical thinking about sustainability
learningOutcomes.sv:
Understand basic concepts around sustainability in the bioproducts industry
Frame sustainability from technology and value chain perspective​s
Learn from applied examples about different methods for analyzing the sustainability of bioproduct production pathways
Build skills for creating evidence-based critical thinking about sustainability
learningOutcomes.en:
Understand basic concepts around sustainability in the bioproducts industry
Frame sustainability from technology and value chain perspective​s
Learn from applied examples about different methods for analyzing the sustainability of bioproduct production pathways
Build skills for creating evidence-based critical thinking about sustainability

content.fi:
Description of course content:​
Basic concepts of sustainability, sustainable development, bioeconomy and circular economy are introduced. Following, the students will identify linkages of these concepts from a value chain perspective considering the source of material all the way to the end-of-life management of the final product. ​
Real examples will be described covering early-stage to established bioproduct industrial processes.​
Experts in sustainability assessment will be invited to provide guest lectures.​
Via guided exercises the students will build critical thinking for risks identification and help identify sustainability indicators by brainstorming cases discussed in class.​

learningOutcomes.fi:
After completing the course, the students will be able to understand the theoretical background of surface and colloid chemistry, and apply that knowledge in bioproducts engineering. In particular, the students will be able to:
  • Understand how surface energy and roughness affect the wettability of surfaces.
  • Identify different methods to modify surface properties.
  • Understand the fundaments of key surface analysis techniques.
  • Interpret the role of surface active components in surface modification, as well as in emulsions and foams.
  • Discuss the advantages and disadvantages of nanoparticles.
  • Comprehend different surface forces and how they affect the stability of colloidal dispersions.
  • Explain how polymers adsorb on surfaces and how they affect the interactions between particles or surfaces.

  • Understand the fundaments of key surface analysis techniques.
  • Interpret the role of surface active components in surface modification, as well as in emulsions and foams.
  • Discuss the advantages and disadvantages of nanoparticles.
  • Comprehend different surface forces and how they affect the stability of colloidal dispersions.
  • Explain how polymers adsorb on surfaces and how they affect the interactions between particles or surfaces.
learningOutcomes.en:
After completing the course, the students will be able to understand the theoretical background of surface and colloid chemistry, and apply that knowledge in bioproducts engineering. In particular, the students will be able to:
  • Understand how surface energy and roughness affect the wettability of surfaces.
  • Identify different methods to modify surface properties.
  • Understand the fundaments of key surface analysis techniques.
  • Interpret the role of surface active components in surface modification, as well as in emulsions and foams.
  • Discuss the advantages and disadvantages of nanoparticles.
  • Comprehend different surface forces and how they affect the stability of colloidal dispersions.
  • Explain how polymers adsorb on surfaces and how they affect the interactions between particles or surfaces.

content.fi: This course offers a solid theoretical background on surface and colloid chemistry useful to understand different interfacial phenomena and material modification in any field in general, and in bioproduct engineering in particular. The following topics are included in the course: surface energy, surface tension, adhesion, wetting, adsorption, surface modification, surface analysis techniques, surfactants, polymers, nanoparticles, emulsions, foams, colloidal stability, surface forces (van der Waals forces, electrical double layer repulsion, DLVO theory, forces induced by adsorbed polymers).

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course the student is able to
  • Master the chemical and morphologicall structure of native and processed cellulosic fibres and acknowledge how it affects nanocellulose preparation and properties
  • Master the morphology of the native cellulose microfibril and acknowledge how it affects nanocellulose preparation and properties
  • Distinguish different grades of cellulose nanocrystals and nanofibres from each other
  • Explain comprehensively how nanocellulose is produced
  • Explain the main pathways to chemical modification of nanocellulose
  • Choose a correct analytical technique to characterize a desired property of nanocellulose
  • Apply basic structure-property relationship to nanocellulose materials and understand their implications in most common modern applications

content.fi: Nanocellulose isolation, analysis, characteristics and applications; isolation of wood and non-wood fibres from the plant material; cell wall structure of lignocellulosic fibres; chemical structure and most common chemical reactions of cell wall components; crystallinity and morphology of cellulose; structure-property relationships of nanocellulose; sorption behaviour and effect on properties; crystal/fibre mechanics and modelling; materials applications of nanocellulose
content.sv: Nanocellulose isolation, analysis, characteristics and applications; isolation of wood and non-wood fibres from the plant material; cell wall structure of lignocellulosic fibres; chemical structure and most common chemical reactions of cell wall components; crystallinity and morphology of cellulose; structure-property relationships of nanocellulose; sorption behaviour and effect on properties; crystal/fibre mechanics and modelling; materials applications of nanocellulose
content.en: Nanocellulose isolation, analysis, characteristics and applications; isolation of wood and non-wood fibres from the plant material; cell wall structure of lignocellulosic fibres; chemical structure and most common chemical reactions of cell wall components; crystallinity and morphology of cellulose; structure-property relationships of nanocellulose; sorption behaviour and effect on properties; crystal/fibre mechanics and modelling; materials applications of nanocellulose

content.fi: In this course, students will work on project that targets the substitution of a more sustainable raw material or process chemical for a more problematic current solution. Students will form teams that will address different parts of this problem. For example, teams will evaluate the effect of the new solution on product properties of process eficiency. The exact problem will vary according to current industry focus areas. Likewise, the mission of the individual teams will vary depending on the backgrounds of the students and needed tasks to complete. The teams will pass several stage gates to present their final results and recomendations in the final class.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course the students
- will be able to perform basic microbiology and molecular biology laboratory experiments
- can apply methods used in biotechnology laboratories
- can genetically modify microbial expression hosts
- will be able to plan and conduct basic experimental work by themselves
- can analyze and report experimental results.

content.fi:
This course provides the theoretical background and basic practical skills required for working in a bioscience laboratory. Topics will cover:
- use of aseptic technique in the laboratory
- culturing pro- and eukaryotic cells
- working with DNA (e.g. PCR, molecular cloning, expression)
- working with proteins (e.g. ELISA, SDS-PAGE)

learningOutcomes.fi:
ILO1 – analyze the bioprocess scale-up parameters for commercial applications
ILO2 - interpret and optimize the bioprocess parameters to improve the bioprocess outcome. ILO3 – apply the principles of mathematics, natural science, and engineering in determining and solving contemporary and complex problems in bioprocessing. ILO4 – decide on the most feasible downstream processing strategy in industrial applications
ILO5 - design a bioprocess starting from a single cell to a final product
ILO6 - present the importance of bioprocess technology for a sustainable and circular bioeconomy to a group audience and appreciate the importance of group work.

prerequisites.fi:

  • CHEM-E3115 Industrial Biotechnology OR
  • CHEM-E3140 Bioprocess Technology II AND CHEM-E3110 Biolab I OR
  • CHEM-E3112 Laboratory Course in Molecular Biotechnology
The laboratory safety course CHEM-A1030, CHEM-E0111, CHEM-A1010 or CHEM-E0140 must be completed before starting laboratory work.

learningOutcomes.fi:
On successful completion of this course, students can:
ILO1 - design, implement, analyze, and report the experimental procedures in the wet lab on biological phenomena and bioprocesses. ILO2 - understand and interpret metabolic responses in bioprocessing and adapt methods to analyze and tune them for industrial applications for improved process efficiency. ILO3 - apply their theoretical knowledge, problem-solving, and practical skills to develop processes and products
ILO4 - apply modern techniques of measurements, analysis, and control at different levels of examinations (molecular, cellular, population, reactor, process, plant)
ILO5 - master the experimental planning, time management, data analysis, and interpretation within a team.

ILO3 - apply their theoretical knowledge, problem-solving, and practical skills to develop processes and products ILO4 - apply modern techniques of measurements, analysis, and control at different levels of examinations (molecular, cellular, population, reactor, process, plant)ILO5 - master the experimental planning, time management, data analysis, and interpretation within a team.

ILO2 - understand and interpret metabolic responses in bioprocessing and adapt methods to analyze and tune them for industrial applications for improved process efficiency.
ILO3 - apply their theoretical knowledge, problem-solving, and practical skills to develop processes and products ILO4 - apply modern techniques of measurements, analysis, and control at different levels of examinations (molecular, cellular, population, reactor, process, plant)ILO5 - master the experimental planning, time management, data analysis, and interpretation within a team.

content.fi: The objective of the course is to provide hands-on experience in bioprocess technology in laboratory and pilot scale. The course consists of two laboratory experiments: 1) Cultivation of a genetically modified Escherichia Coli strain in a 1,5 L laboratory-scale bioreactor for the production of a recombinant protein, product purification, and product analysis.  2) Pilot-scale fermentation process for the large-scale production of sugar alcohol, various downstream processing steps for product purification, and process analytics.
content.sv: The objective of the course is to provide hands-on experience in bioprocess technology in laboratory and pilot scale. The course consists of two laboratory experiments: 1) Cultivation of a genetically modified Escherichia Coli strain in a 1,5 L laboratory-scale bioreactor for the production of a recombinant protein, product purification, and product analysis.  2) Pilot-scale fermentation process for the large-scale production of sugar alcohol, various downstream processing steps for product purification, and process analytics.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After having passed this course the student can:
  • analyze material systems for potential, innovative concepts with thin films
  • indentify the functions of materials that can be engineered by thin films
  • predict how the physical characteristics correlate with thin-film properties and functions
  • select characterization methods for the key physical properties of thin films
  • select the optimal thin-film deposition methods and materials based on the case

content.fi:
• holistic approach to engineering of material systems by thin films
  • analysis of thin-film functionalities, and how they correlate with fundamental properties
  • translations of thin-film structure to a set of properties
  • overview of characterization methods to understand thin-film structures
  • toolbox of deposition method to achieve the desired thin film and structure

learningOutcomes.fi:
This course provides basic engineering skills for working in a compay's investment and development project. After the course the student
1. has acquired advanced knowledge on process design and preliminary plant design
2. can size industrial scale process equipment
3. can calculate material and energy balances
4. can use simulation in process design
5. can draw block and process flow diagrams (PFD)
6. can work in project groups towards a common goal
7. can manage a team and learn leadership
8. can run and manage a project as project manager
learningOutcomes.sv: This course provides basic engineering skills for working in a compay's investment and development project. After the course the student1. has acquired advanced knowledge on process design and preliminary plant design2. can size industrial scale process equipment3. can calculate material and energy balances 4. can use simulation in process design5. can draw block and process flow diagrams (PFD)6. can work in project groups towards a common goal7. can manage a team and learn leadership8. can run and manage a project as project manager
learningOutcomes.en: This course provides basic engineering skills for working in a compay's investment and development project. After the course the student1. has acquired advanced knowledge on process design and preliminary plant design2. can size industrial scale process equipment3. can calculate material and energy balances 4. can use simulation in process design5. can draw block and process flow diagrams (PFD)6. can work in project groups towards a common goal7. can manage a team and learn leadership8. can run and manage a project as project manager

content.fi:
1. Basics of plant design2. Dimensioning the process and the most common equipment 3. Comparison of process alternatives4. Process design: material and energy balance, block diagram, PFD5. Use of design tools (drawing, simulation)
Continuation of Principles of Plant and Process Design (CHEM-E7127). Project work is done in same team of 5-6 students. The design project in part B is divided into two reports:1. Background information (SoA), process comparison and selection2. Mass balance, process flow diagram
The reports are presented in project meetings with industrial and university advisors that are organised by one member of the student group (project manager). The work is to be continued with the same student groups in Autumn periods I and II in Capstone Project for Plant Design.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course:
1. can draw flow and P&I-diagrams, layout and define utilities, emissions and waste of the plant
2. can define equipment specification and instructions
3. can apply out safety (HAZOP) analysis of the process
4. can calculate capital investment, operating cost, production cost, analyze profitability and financial planning and business model
5. can clearly demonstrate team work with clear 
6. can manage group work and show leadership skills
7. understands the characteristics of real plant design
learningOutcomes.sv: After the course:1. can draw flow and P&I-diagrams, layout and define utilities, emissions and waste of the plant2. can define equipment specification and instructions3. can apply out safety (HAZOP) analysis of the process4. can calculate capital investment, operating cost, production cost, analyze profitability and financial planning and business model5. can clearly demonstrate team work with clear 6. can manage group work and show leadership skills 7. understands the characteristics of real plant design
learningOutcomes.en: After the course:1. can draw flow and P&I-diagrams, layout and define utilities, emissions and waste of the plant2. can define equipment specification and instructions3. can apply out safety (HAZOP) analysis of the process4. can calculate capital investment, operating cost, production cost, analyze profitability and financial planning and business model5. can clearly demonstrate team work with clear 6. can manage group work and show leadership skills 7. understands the characteristics of real plant design

content.fi:
Continuation of Principles of Plant and Process Design (CHEM-E7127). Project work is done in same team of 5-6 students. The design project in part B is divided into three reports:1. Flow and P&I diagram, equipment specifications, instructions, layout, laws, regulation and permits, methods of safety analysis (HAZOP), heat integration2. Cost estimations, capital cost, operating cost, profitability, time schedule and business model3. Final report for investment decision
Learning diary is also required.
The reports are presented in project meetings with industrial and university advisors that are organised by one member of the student group (project manager)

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: Conservation laws, ordinary differential equations, linear algebra, probability theory, numerical methods, programming.
prerequisites.sv: Recommended prerequisites: Conservation laws, ordinary differential equations, linear algebra, probability theory, numerical methods, programming.
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: Conservation laws, ordinary differential equations, linear algebra, probability theory, numerical methods, programming.

learningOutcomes.fi:
The actual learning outcomes of the course vary from year to year according to the content.

Project work:
Learning outcomes After the course the student: - Knows the structure and requirements for current automation systems;
- Is able to configure a small DCS system for lab unit processes using ABB 800xA system and information systems environment;
- Knows the basics in process automation programming and Python languages;
- Knows the meaning of process system interfaces (OPC UA, ODBC);
- Knows the benefits, limitations and properties of industrial field buses and can apply this knowledge in the automation system design;
- Knows how to collect the data from measurements and making data analysis in the cloud computing system;
- Knows what wireless smart sensors are and how to configure and connect them into the cloud computing system;
- Knows what is the benefit of 5G wireless network and how to utilize it in the automation system.
- Knows how to connect Raspberry and Arduino into the cloud computing system

content.fi: Postgraduate level knowledge in process systems engineering (dynamics, control, optimisation, automation systems or machine learning). The actual contents of the course vary from year to year.Project work:In this course the student learns to configure and operate the current automation systems, utilizing the latest technological tools "Industry 4.0", Industrial Internet of Things, Cloud computing and 5G. The automation setup used in the course will prepare the students for the future automation challenges with the latest tools and merges data analytics, cloud computing and wireless network studies with process automation.

learningOutcomes.fi: Process safety and risk management focuses on the prevention and mitigation of releases of hazardous materials that may lead to fires, explosions, or toxic impacts. This course prepares students for understading the process hazard, hazard evaluation,  consequence analysis, accident investigation, and risk management. Guest Lecturer from industry will present first-hand knowledge of industrial process safety and risk management. After the course, the student 1. Can acquire the basic knowledge of safety in chemical process industry 2. Can identify the hazard of chemicals, chemical processes and apply ISD principles which offers a sustainable process design 3. Can develop and understand the safety management, culture & sustainability 4. Can identify the risk of damages and accidents in chemical process industry and method of prevention 5. Can apply the hazard and safety analysis methods 6. Can identify fires and explosions, and design the preventions 7. Can use the methods and techniques to control the hazards and chemical process
learningOutcomes.sv:
Process safety and risk management focuses on the prevention and mitigation of releases of hazardous materials that may lead to fires, explosions, or toxic impacts. This course prepares students for understading the process hazard, hazard evaluation,  consequence analysis, accident investigation, and risk management. Guest Lecturer from industry will present first-hand knowledge of industrial process safety and risk management.

After the course, the student
1. Can acquire the basic knowledge of safety in chemical process industry
2. Can identify the hazard of chemicals, chemical processes and apply ISD principles which offers a sustainable process design
3. Can develop and understand the safety management, culture & sustainability
4. Can identify the risk of damages and accidents in chemical process industry and method of prevention
5. Can apply the hazard and safety analysis methods
6. Can identify fires and explosions, and design the preventions
7. Can use the methods and techniques to control the hazards and chemical process

7. Can use the methods and techniques to control the hazards and chemical process

content.fi: 1. Introduction of process safety, Inherent safety2. Hazard, risk, toxicology and industrial hygiene, legislations3. Fires and explosions; Dow FEI index and CEI index 4. Reliefs and relief equipment sizing5. Hazards identification methods, HAZOP, consequence analysis & QRA6. Active and passive safety7. Development of safety management, culture and sustainability8. Human factor, Reach, ATEX

learningOutcomes.fi: Process safety and risk management focuses on the prevention and mitigation of releases of hazardous materials that may lead to fires, explosions, or toxic impacts. This course prepares students for understading the process hazard, hazard evaluation,  consequence analysis, accident investigation, and risk management. Guest Lecturer from industry will present first-hand knowledge of industrial process safety and risk management. After the course, the student 1. Can acquire the basic knowledge of safety in chemical process industry 2. Can identify the hazard of chemicals, chemical processes and apply ISD principles which offers a sustainable process design 3. Can develop and understand the safety management, culture & sustainability 4. Can identify the risk of damages and accidents in chemical process industry and method of prevention 5. Can apply the hazard and safety analysis methods 6. Can identify fires and explosions, and design the preventions 7. Can use the methods and techniques to control the hazards and chemical process
learningOutcomes.sv:
Process safety and risk management focuses on the prevention and mitigation of releases of hazardous materials that may lead to fires, explosions, or toxic impacts. This course prepares students for understading the process hazard, hazard evaluation,  consequence analysis, accident investigation, and risk management. Guest Lecturer from industry will present first-hand knowledge of industrial process safety and risk management.

After the course, the student
1. Can acquire the basic knowledge of safety in chemical process industry
2. Can identify the hazard of chemicals, chemical processes and apply ISD principles which offers a sustainable process design
3. Can develop and understand the safety management, culture & sustainability
4. Can identify the risk of damages and accidents in chemical process industry and method of prevention
5. Can apply the hazard and safety analysis methods
6. Can identify fires and explosions, and design the preventions
7. Can use the methods and techniques to control the hazards and chemical process
learningOutcomes.en:
Process safety and risk management focuses on the prevention and mitigation of releases of hazardous materials that may lead to fires, explosions, or toxic impacts. This course prepares students for understading the process hazard, hazard evaluation,  consequence analysis, accident investigation, and risk management. Guest Lecturer from industry will present first-hand knowledge of industrial process safety and risk management.

After the course, the student
1. Can acquire the basic knowledge of safety in chemical process industry
2. Can identify the hazard of chemicals, chemical processes and apply ISD principles which offers a sustainable process design
3. Can develop and understand the safety management, culture & sustainability
4. Can identify the risk of damages and accidents in chemical process industry and method of prevention
5. Can apply the hazard and safety analysis methods
6. Can identify fires and explosions, and design the preventions
7. Can use the methods and techniques to control the hazards and chemical process

content.fi: 1. Introduction of process safety, Inherent safety2. Hazard, risk, toxicology and industrial hygiene, legislations3. Fires and explosions; Dow FEI index and CEI index 4. Reliefs and relief equipment sizing5. Hazards identification methods, HAZOP, consequence analysis & QRA6. Active and passive safety7. Development of safety management, culture and sustainability8. Human factor, Reach, ATEX

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course the students are able to:
  1. give the definition of catalysis and describe concepts related to heterogeneous and homogeneous catalysts
  2. explain steps and methods in catalyst preparation
  3. describe and apply selected catalyst characterization methods
  4. explain why and how catalysts deactivate and how catalyst deactivation can be postponed or prevented
  5. give examples of where catalysts are applied
  6. recognize challenges potentially solvable by catalytic reactions

learningOutcomes.fi:
On completion of this course, the student will be able to:
  1. Analyze the principles and techniques involved in cell engineering, encompassing genetic engineering techniques, and other methods to modify cellular behavior.
  2. Assess diverse applications of cell engineering in biotechnology, including the production of small molecules and proteins.
  3. Apply systems biology concepts to understand how cellular components interact in the context of cell engineering.
  4. Evaluate challenges in cell engineering projects, critically analyze potential solutions, and decide on effective strategies to address engineering goals.
learningOutcomes.sv:
On completion of this course, the student will be able to:
  1. Analyze the principles and techniques involved in cell engineering, encompassing genetic engineering techniques, and other methods to modify cellular behavior.
  2. Assess diverse applications of cell engineering in biotechnology, including the production of small molecules and proteins.
  3. Apply systems biology concepts to understand how cellular components interact in the context of cell engineering.
  4. Evaluate challenges in cell engineering projects, critically analyze potential solutions, and decide on effective strategies to address engineering goals.
learningOutcomes.en:
On completion of this course, the student will be able to:
  1. Analyze the principles and techniques involved in cell engineering, encompassing genetic engineering techniques, and other methods to modify cellular behavior.
  2. Assess diverse applications of cell engineering in biotechnology, including the production of small molecules and proteins.
  3. Apply systems biology concepts to understand how cellular components interact in the context of cell engineering.
  4. Evaluate challenges in cell engineering projects, critically analyze potential solutions, and decide on effective strategies to address engineering goals.

content.fi: This course provides a comprehensive exploration of the principles, techniques, and applications of cell engineering for small molecule and protein production. Genetic engineering methodologies as well as other techniques to modify cellular behavior will be delved into, and characteristics of host cells analyzed. Future directions of the field will be discussed, and challenges and opportunities anticipated.
