learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course the student is able to:
  • Recall, define, and discuss the basic concepts of circular economy and successfully apply them within the field of raw materials production.
  • Assess the physical and chemical advantages and limitations in different technological steps and methods for both metal and plastics recycling.
  • Apply a systemic perspective in designing resource efficient recycling processes.
  • Identify the scale of the challenges connected to materials consumption and recycling today and in the near future.
learningOutcomes.sv:
After the course the student is able to:
  • Recall, define, and discuss the basic concepts of circular economy and successfully apply them within the field of raw materials production.
  • Assess the physical and chemical advantages and limitations in different technological steps and methods for both metal and plastics recycling.
  • Apply a systemic perspective in designing resource efficient recycling processes.
  • Identify the scale of the challenges connected to materials consumption and recycling today and in the near future.
learningOutcomes.en:
After the course the student is able to:
  • Recall, define, and discuss the basic concepts of circular economy and successfully apply them within the field of raw materials production.
  • Assess the physical and chemical advantages and limitations in different technological steps and methods for both metal and plastics recycling.
  • Apply a systemic perspective in designing resource efficient recycling processes.
  • Identify the scale of the challenges connected to materials consumption and recycling today and in the near future.

content.fi:
• Introduction to the value chain of metals – from mining to recycling.
  • Fundamental concepts in plastics production, plastic waste processing, and plastics recycling.
  • Concepts of circular economy and resource efficiency.
  • Steps in metal recycling process: mechanical pre-processing, hydrometallurgical and pyrometallurgical processing.
  • Mechanical and chemical recycling of plastics: current status, challenges, and emerging technologies. 
  • Challenges in metal recycling: waste management, waste collection, thermodynamic limitations, economic feasibility. 
  • Environmental impacts of waste materials and their recycling processes. 
  • Principles of life cycle assessment (LCA) and challenges.
content.sv:
• Introduction to the value chain of metals – from mining to recycling.
  • Fundamental concepts in plastics production, plastic waste processing, and plastics recycling.
  • Concepts of circular economy and resource efficiency.
  • Steps in metal recycling process: mechanical pre-processing, hydrometallurgical and pyrometallurgical processing.
  • Mechanical and chemical recycling of plastics: current status, challenges, and emerging technologies. 
  • Challenges in metal recycling: waste management, waste collection, thermodynamic limitations, economic feasibility. 
  • Environmental impacts of waste materials and their recycling processes. 
  • Principles of life cycle assessment (LCA) and challenges.
content.en:
• Introduction to the value chain of metals – from mining to recycling.
  • Fundamental concepts in plastics production, plastic waste processing, and plastics recycling.
  • Concepts of circular economy and resource efficiency.
  • Steps in metal recycling process: mechanical pre-processing, hydrometallurgical and pyrometallurgical processing.
  • Mechanical and chemical recycling of plastics: current status, challenges, and emerging technologies. 
  • Challenges in metal recycling: waste management, waste collection, thermodynamic limitations, economic feasibility. 
  • Environmental impacts of waste materials and their recycling processes. 
  • Principles of life cycle assessment (LCA) and challenges.

additionalInformation.fi:
Teaching Language: English Teaching Period: 2024-2025 Autumn II  2025-2026 Autumn II Registration: Max 100 students prioritized in the following order: 
1. All the students (including doctoral students) in the major Sustainable Metals Processing from the ‘Chemical, Biochemical, and Materials Engineering’; ‘Chemical and Process Engineering’ and ‘Sustainable Metallurgical Engineering’ from the Chemical and Metallurgical Engineering Master’s Program, as well as students from Creative Sustainability CHEM Master's Program are selected if enrolled in time. 
2. Students in the master’s programs in Chemical, Biochemical, and Materials Engineering’ i.e. ‘Fibre and Polymer Engineering’ and ‘Functional Materials’ 
3. Students in the master’s program in ‘Chemical, Biochemical, and materials Engineering’ i.e. ‘Biomass Refining’, ‘Biotechnology’, and ‘Chemistry’. 
A course implementation may be cancelled if the number of students enrolled to the course implementation does not meet the required minimum of five students. In the case of cancelled course implementations, the students enrolled to them must be provided with an alternative way of completing the course or be advised to take some other applicable course.

2. Students in the master’s programs in Chemical, Biochemical, and Materials Engineering’ i.e. ‘Fibre and Polymer Engineering’ and ‘Functional Materials’

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course the students will be able to:
  1. Utilize public databases and analyze sequence data to search for potential enzymes and to predict enzymatic functionalities.
  2. Assess methods to evaluate related enzyme activities.
  3. Design genetic engineering strategies to modify proteins leading to improved or altered performance or to novel or improved products.
  4. Visualize and analyze the structure-function relationship of enzymes.
  5. Justify strategies for the recombinant production and purification of enzymes from different origin and with different cofactor requirements.
  6. Design a scientific or a research and development project relating to the application of enzymes to address academic, industrial, or societal problems.
  7. Critically analyze and assess relevant literature and apply it to solve challenges in enzyme design.
  8. Report and discuss scientific results in oral and written form.
learningOutcomes.sv:
After the course the students will be able to:
  1. Utilize public databases and analyze sequence data to search for potential enzymes and to predict enzymatic functionalities.
  2. Assess methods to evaluate related enzyme activities.
  3. Design genetic engineering strategies to modify proteins leading to improved or altered performance or to novel or improved products.
  4. Visualize and analyze the structure-function relationship of enzymes.
  5. Justify strategies for the recombinant production and purification of enzymes from different origin and with different cofactor requirements.
  6. Design a scientific or a research and development project relating to the application of enzymes to address academic, industrial, or societal problems.
  7. Critically analyze and assess relevant literature and apply it to solve challenges in enzyme design.
  8. Report and discuss scientific results in oral and written form.
learningOutcomes.en:
After the course the students will be able to:
  1. Utilize public databases and analyze sequence data to search for potential enzymes and to predict enzymatic functionalities.
  2. Assess methods to evaluate related enzyme activities.
  3. Design genetic engineering strategies to modify proteins leading to improved or altered performance or to novel or improved products.
  4. Visualize and analyze the structure-function relationship of enzymes.
  5. Justify strategies for the recombinant production and purification of enzymes from different origin and with different cofactor requirements.
  6. Design a scientific or a research and development project relating to the application of enzymes to address academic, industrial, or societal problems.
  7. Critically analyze and assess relevant literature and apply it to solve challenges in enzyme design.
  8. Report and discuss scientific results in oral and written form.

content.fi: The course covers aspects which are relevant to both academic research and industrial applications revolving around enzymes. Topics covered include enzyme production, methods to assess enzyme activities and kinetics, as well as in-depth understanding of the current methods used to design and engineer proteins. The learnings will be applied to relevant case studies to illustrate the diversity of enzyme applications and to analyze the suitability of the varying methods used to select, design and produce enzymes.

learningOutcomes.fi: General understanding of powder metallurgy methods (PM). Learning of different manufacturing methods of powders. Basics of compaction and sintering process, technilogy and equipment. PM post-rpcessing methods and applications. Selected cases (hard metals, coatings, porous materials, bearings) and special methods (like injection moulding). PM economics and sustainability.

prerequisites.fi: Compulsory prerequisites: BSc level organic, inorganic or physical chemistry depending on the topic. If laboratory work is included to the course the student need to have adequate laboratory skills. Before starting the course the student must contact the teacher/instructor. The laboratory safety course CHEM-A1030, CHEM-E0111, CHEM-A1010 or CHEM-E0140 must be completed before starting laboratory work.

If laboratory work is included to the course the student need to have adequate laboratory skills. Before starting the course the student must contact the teacher/instructor. learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course the student will be able to: 1. search for relevant literature on a given topic and critically evaluate scientific articles
2. perform laboratory or simulation based research on a given topic
3. draw conclusions from results obtained and from results presented in the literature
4. compare results with the literature
5. present experimental results in a clear and logical way in a laboratory report/seminar

organizationName.en: Department of Chemistry and Materials Science

name.en: Laboratory and Chemical Safety, Independent Study

workload.fi: Kurssimateriaalien itsenäinen opiskelu virtuaalilaboratoriossa ja digitaalinen tentti.
workload.sv: Självstudier av kursmaterial i ett virtuellt laboratorium och en digital tentamen.
workload.en: Independent study of course materials in a virtual laboratory and a digital exam.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin jälkeen opiskelija osaa:
1. työskennellä turvallisesti laboratoriossa
2. valita sopivat henkilökohtaiset suojavälineet ja käyttää laboratorion turvavälineitä
3. tunnistaa mahdollisia riskitekijöitä laboratoriotöissä
4. käsitellä laboratoriojätteitä oikein
learningOutcomes.sv:
Efter godkänd kurs ska studenten kunna:
1. arbeta tryggt i laboratoriet2. välja lämplig personlig skyddsutrustning och använda säkerhetsredskapen i laboratoriet3. identifiera möjliga riskfaktorer i laboratoriet4. behandla laboratorieavfallen på ett riktigt sätt
learningOutcomes.en:
After the course student is able to
1. work safely in laboratory2. choose proper personal protective equipment and use safety equipment in the laboratory3. recognize possible risk factors in the laboratory work4. handle laboratory waste in appropriate manner

content.fi: Yleiskatsaus laboratorion työturvallisuuteen ja kemikaaliturvallisuuteen. Turvalliset työtavat, varoitusmerkit, käyttöturvallisuustiedotteet, suojavälineet ja laboratoriojätteiden käsittely. Ensiapu tyypillisissä laboratoriossa tapahtuvissa onnettomuuksissa.
content.sv: En översikt över laboratoriesäkerhet och kemikaliesäkerhet. Säkra arbetsmetoder, varningsmärken, säkerhetsdatablad, skyddsutrustning och behandling av laboratorieavfall. Första hjälp i typiska laboratorieolyckor.
content.en: General overview in laboratory safety and chemical safety. Safe working methods, warning signs, safety data sheets, protective equipment and laboratory waste management. First aid after typical laboratory accidents.

assesmentMethods.fi: Digitaalinen tentti
assesmentMethods.sv: Digital tentamen
assesmentMethods.en: Digital exam

substitutes.fi: Laboratorioturvallisuuskurssit CHEM-E0111, CHEM-A1010 tai CHEM-E0140 (0 op)
substitutes.sv: Laborationssäkerhetskurserna CHEM-E0111, CHEM-A1010 eller CHEM-E0140 (0 sp)
substitutes.en: Laboratory safety courses CHEM-E0111, CHEM-A1010 tai CHEM-E0140 (0 op)

organizationName.en: Department of Chemistry and Materials Science

workload.fi: Luennot, lukupiiri, laboratoriotyöt.
workload.sv: Föreläsningar, läsecirklar, laboratorie experiment
workload.en: Lectures, reading circle, laboratory works.

prerequisites.fi: Pakolliset esitiedot: - Kandipääaine: Kemia ja materiaalitiede - CHEM-C2450 Materiaalien ominaisuudet Laboratorioturvallisuuskurssi CHEM-A1030, CHEM-E0111, CHEM-A1010 tai CHEM-E0140 on oltava suoritettuna ennen laboratoriotöiden aloittamista.Suositellut esitiedot: - CHEM-C3410 Nanomaterials
prerequisites.sv: Obligatoriska förkunskaper: - Kandidathuvudämne: Kemi och materialvetenskap - CHEM-C2450 Materials egenskaper För deltagande i laborationerna krävs godkänd kurs i laborationssäkerhet: CHEM-A1030, CHEM-E0111, CHEM-A1010 eller CHEM-E0140.Rekommenderade förkunskaper: - CHEM-C3410 Nanomaterials
prerequisites.en: Compulsory prerequisites: - Bachelor major: Chemistry and Materials Science - CHEM-C2450 Properties of Materials The laboratory safety course CHEM-A1030, CHEM-E0111, CHEM-A1010 or CHEM-E0140 must be completed before starting laboratory work.Recommended prerequisites: - CHEM-C3410 Nanomaterials

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin jälkeen opiskelijaa 
  • ymmärtää sähkökemiallisen ja kemiallisen reaktion eron
  • ymmärtää spontaanin ja kontrolloidun sähkökemiallisen reaktion eron
  • osaa nimetä eri sähkökemian tutkimus- ja sovellusalueita
  • ymmärtää sähkökemian keskeisen roolin kestävässä kehityksessä ja vihreässä siirtymässä
  • osaa etsiä ja lukea sähkökemiallisia julkaisuja
  • osaa toistaa yksinkertaisen sähkökemiallisen labortatoriokokeen
learningOutcomes.sv:
Efter kursen kan studenten
  • förstå skillnaden mellan elektrokemisk och kemisk reaktionen
  • förstå skillnaden mellan en spontan och en kontrollerad elektrokemisk reaktion
  • namnge olika forsknings- och tillämpningsområden inom elektrokemin
  • förstå elektrokemins centrala roll i hållbarhet och grön transition
  • söka och läsa elektrokemiska publikationer
  • upprepa ett enkelt elektrokemiskt laboratorie experiment
learningOutcomes.en:
After the course the student can
  • understand the difference between electrochemical and chemical reaction
  • understand the difference between spontaneous and controlled electrochemical reaction
  • name different research and application areas in electrochemistry
  • understands the central role of electrochemistry in sustainability and green transition
  • find and read scientific publications of electrochemistry
  • repeat a simple electrochemical measurement

content.fi: Luento- ja lukupiirien aihepiirejä: sähkökemian rooli vihreässä siirtymässä (esim. aurinko- ja polttokennot, akut, vedyntuotanto, katalyytit), metallien sähkökemiallinen valmistus ja kierrätys. Kurssilla on myös laboratoriotöitä.
content.sv: Ämnen för föreläsningar och läsecirklar: elektrokemisk i grön transition (t.e. sol- och bränsleceller, batterier, väteproduktion, katalysmaterial),elektrokemisk produktion och återvinning av metaller.  Kursen har laborationsexperiment.
content.en: Topics for lectures and reading circles: role of electrochemistry in green transition (e.g. solar and fuel cells, batteries, hydrogen production, catalyst materials), electrochemical production and recycling of metals.  The course contains also laboratory works.

assesmentMethods.fi: Luennoille ja lukupiiriin osallistuminen, laboratoriotöiden suorittaminen.
assesmentMethods.sv: Delta i föreläsningar och läsecirklar, genomföra laboratiorie experimenter.
assesmentMethods.en: Attendance in lectures and reading circle, performance of laboratory works.

additionalInformation.fi: Opetuskieli: suomi Opetusperiodi: 2024-2025 Kevät III  2025-2026 Kevät III Ilmoittautuminen: Kurssille hyväksytään enintään 36 opiskelijaa. Kurssi on vain kandipääaineen "Kemia ja materiaalitiede" opiskelijoille (Kemian tekniikan korkeakoulu).
additionalInformation.sv: Undervisningsspråket: finska Undervisningsperiod: 2024-2025 Vår III  2025-2026 Vår III Anmälan: Högst 36 studenter accepteras till kursen. Kursen är bara för studenterna i kandidathuvudämnet "Kemi och materialvetenskap" (Högskolan för Kemiteknik).
additionalInformation.en: Teaching Language: Finnish Teaching Period: 2024-2025 Spring III  2025-2026 Spring III Registration: A maximum of 36 students are accepted to the course. The course is only for students of the "Chemistry and Materials Science" bachelor major (School of Chemical Engineering).

teachingPeriod.fi: 2024-2025 Kevät III  2025-2026 Kevät III
teachingPeriod.en: 2024-2025 Spring III  2025-2026 Spring III
teachingPeriod.sv: 2024-2025 Vår III  2025-2026 Vår III

organizationName.en: Department of Chemistry and Materials Science

name.en: Fluid Flow and Heat Transfer, Exam

workload.fi: Luennot 24 hHarjoitukset 48 hKotilaskut 20 hMuu oma opiskelu + tentti 43 h
workload.sv: Föreläsningar 24 h Räkneövningar 48 h Hem uppgifter 20 h Annan självstudie + tentamen 43 h
workload.en: Lectures 24 h Exercises 48 h Home works 20 h Other independent studies + exam 43 h

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin jälkeen opiskelija: - tuntee virtaustekniikan peruskäsitteet, kuten laminaarin ja turbulentin virtauksen, painehäviön sekä Newtoniset ja ei Newtoniset fluidit
- tuntee lämmönsiirron mekanismit ja niiden yhteyden lämmönsiirtonopeuksiin osana laitteiden suunnittelussa tarvittavia taseita
- tuntee tyypillisimmät pumpputyypit
- tuntee dimensiottomien lukujen perusteet ja osaa käyttää niitä
- osaa soveltaa lämpö ja mekaanisen energian taseita teknisissä sovelluksissa, erityisesti lämmönsiirtimien sekä pumppu ja putkistojärjestelmien suunnittelussa.
learningOutcomes.sv: Efter kursen : - känner studerande de grundläggande begreppen i flödesteknik, såsom laminärt och turbulent flöde, tryckförlust och newtonska och icke-newtonska vätskor - känner studerande till värmeöverföringsmekanismerna och deras anslutning till värmeöverföringshastigheterna, som en del av balansräkningar som krävs för planering av apparater - känner studerande till de vanligaste pumptyperna - vet studerande grunderna till dimensionslösa storheter och vet hur man använder dem - kan studerande tillämpa termiska och mekaniska energibalanser i tekniska tillämpningar, särskilt i planering av värmeväxlare och pump- och rörsystem.
learningOutcomes.en:
After the course the student:
- knows the basic concepts of fluid flow, such as laminar and turbulent flow, pressure drop, and Newtonian and non-Newtonian fluids
- knows the mechanisms of heat transfer and their relation to the energy balances needed for design of apparatuses
- knows the most typical pump types
- knows the dimensionless numbers and is capable to use them
- is able to apply balances of thermal and mechanical energy in technical applications, especially in design of pump and pipe systems

content.fi: - Aine ja energiataseet ja niiden sovellukset- Lämmönsiirto- Pumput, putkistot, kompressorit, sekoitus ja lämmönsiirtimet
content.sv:
- mass- och energibalanser och deras tillämpningar
- värmeöverföring
- Pumpar, rörledningar, kompressorer, blandning och värmeväxlaren
content.en:
- Mass and energy balances and their applications
- Heat transfer
- Pumps, pipe lines, compressors, mixing and heat exchangers

assesmentMethods.fi: Luennot, harjoitukset ja kaksi pienryhmissä tehtävää kotilaskua sekä tentti. Tentti sisältää teoria ja laskuosuuden.
assesmentMethods.sv: Föreläsningar, övningar, två hemräkningar och tentamen.
assesmentMethods.en: Lectures, exercises, two home works in small groups and an exam. Exam includes calculation and theory part.

substitutes.fi: CHEM-A1110 Virtaukset ja reaktorit
substitutes.sv: CHEM-A1110 Strömningar och reaktorer
substitutes.en: CHEM-A1110 Flows and Reactors

additionalInformation.en: Teaching Language: Finnish Teaching Period: 2024-2025 Spring III - IV  2025-2026 Spring III - IV

name.en: Fluid Flow and Heat Transfer, Lecture

workload.fi: Luennot 24 hHarjoitukset 48 hKotilaskut 20 hMuu oma opiskelu + tentti 43 h
workload.sv: Föreläsningar 24 h Räkneövningar 48 h Hem uppgifter 20 h Annan självstudie + tentamen 43 h
workload.en: Lectures 24 h Exercises 48 h Home works 20 h Other independent studies + exam 43 h

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin jälkeen opiskelija: - tuntee virtaustekniikan peruskäsitteet, kuten laminaarin ja turbulentin virtauksen, painehäviön sekä Newtoniset ja ei Newtoniset fluidit
- tuntee lämmönsiirron mekanismit ja niiden yhteyden lämmönsiirtonopeuksiin osana laitteiden suunnittelussa tarvittavia taseita
- tuntee tyypillisimmät pumpputyypit
- tuntee dimensiottomien lukujen perusteet ja osaa käyttää niitä
- osaa soveltaa lämpö ja mekaanisen energian taseita teknisissä sovelluksissa, erityisesti lämmönsiirtimien sekä pumppu ja putkistojärjestelmien suunnittelussa.
learningOutcomes.sv: Efter kursen : - känner studerande de grundläggande begreppen i flödesteknik, såsom laminärt och turbulent flöde, tryckförlust och newtonska och icke-newtonska vätskor - känner studerande till värmeöverföringsmekanismerna och deras anslutning till värmeöverföringshastigheterna, som en del av balansräkningar som krävs för planering av apparater - känner studerande till de vanligaste pumptyperna - vet studerande grunderna till dimensionslösa storheter och vet hur man använder dem - kan studerande tillämpa termiska och mekaniska energibalanser i tekniska tillämpningar, särskilt i planering av värmeväxlare och pump- och rörsystem.
learningOutcomes.en:
After the course the student:
- knows the basic concepts of fluid flow, such as laminar and turbulent flow, pressure drop, and Newtonian and non-Newtonian fluids
- knows the mechanisms of heat transfer and their relation to the energy balances needed for design of apparatuses
- knows the most typical pump types
- knows the dimensionless numbers and is capable to use them
- is able to apply balances of thermal and mechanical energy in technical applications, especially in design of pump and pipe systems

learningOutcomes.fi:
Upon completion of the course, student will be able to:
  • understand the relevance of metals in industrially advanced and developing societies and the role of metallurgical engineering in responsible production​
  • describe the unit operations and processes of metals production​
  • apply general thermodynamics and kinetics principles affecting the metals production processes ​
  • recognize the effect of chemical phase equilibria  on processes and product properties​
  • Identify means to assess the environmental impacts of metals production​

  • recognize the effect of chemical phase equilibria  on processes and product properties​
  • Identify means to assess the environmental impacts of metals production​

content.fi:
The course content prepares students from SME major for fundamental courses and gives an overview on metallurgical principles for students from other major​, addressing in particular:
  • Introduction to metallurgical processes
  • Thermodynamics as a driving force in metallurgical processes​
  • Mass and energy balances from the context of metallurgical processes e.g. recirculation of water in the system, energy balance in high-temperature reactors​. The use of transport phenomena
  • Introduction to unit operations and processes in minerals engineering, hydrometallurgy and pyrometallurgy​
  • ​Metallurgical accounting (e.g. uncertainty analysis)​
  • Sustainability in context of metallurgical engineering​
Lectures 2 weekly (combination of traditional slides lectures and examples of calculations, with short explanation on how to start homework)​

additionalInformation.fi:
Teaching Language: English Teaching Period: 2024-2025 Autumn I  2025-2026 Autumn I Registration: Students for this course have to have background equivalent to completed 3rd year Bachelor course "Metallurgian prosessit" (metallurgical processes).
This background covers basics in the unit operations and processes of materials production​, the most important phenomena affecting the materials production processes and the laws affecting their rates​, basic simulation techniques in typical materials technology manufacturing/production processes in equilibrium​, the effect of chemical phase equilibria on processes and product properties.
This course comprises a large group of students (60-80 and more is possible).

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: No compulsory prerequisite. Recommended prerequisite: CHEM-E2225 Wood Material Science, 5 cr
prerequisites.sv: Recommended prerequisites: No compulsory prerequisite. Recommended prerequisite: CHEM-E2225 Wood Material Science, 5 cr
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: No compulsory prerequisite. Recommended prerequisite: CHEM-E2225 Wood Material Science, 5 cr

learningOutcomes.fi:
Learning outcomes. After this course students:
  • are able to perform basic static analysis of forces acting on rigid bodies
  • are familiar with the behaviour of deformable bodies under different load types
  • are able to determine the mechanical properties of wood materials from standardized tests
  • know how environmental conditions influences the physical and mechanical properties
  • are familiar with the rheology of wood and time dependent effects
  • appreciate the natural variability of wood properties and know how growth irregularities and defects influence the mechanical properties
  • are able to apply statistical methods to describe the mechanical properties, their variability and correlations.
  • are familiar with methods for non-destructive testing and evaluation of wood properties
  • know how to develop models for the prediction of strength and stiffness 
  • are familiar with modern wood products and their applications

content.fi: Aimed at students wishing to specialize in wood material mechanics, this course will also be of interest to students of architecture, civil & structural engineering, materials science & engineering and related disciplines, who have an interest in the possibilities offered by wood. This course covers the basic principles of wood mechanics and the use of wood and wood-based products from the perspective of mechanical behavior. A fundamental overview of deformable bodies and their response under various load types is presented and linked to experimental methods for the determination of mechanical properties. Methods for statistical analysis and prediction modelling of material properties are covered together with application and design considerations for (engineered) wood products. Through this course, students will also appreciate the complex nature of wood and learn how to analyze the mechanical properties for design and application purposes.

prerequisites.fi: Laboratorioturvallisuuskurssi CHEM-A1010 tai CHEM-E0140 on oltava suoritettuna ennen laboratoriotöiden aloittamista.
prerequisites.sv: För deltagande i laborationerna krävs godkänd kurs i laborationssäkerhet, antingen CHEM-A1010 eller CHEM-E0140.
prerequisites.en: Laboratory safety course CHEM-A1010 or CHEM-E0140 must have been passed before performing any laboratory works in this course.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin suoritettuaan opiskelija osaa
- nimetä solujen (kasvi, mikrobi, eläin) perusrakenteita
- esittää esimerkkejä aminohappojen ja proteiinien rakenteista ja toiminnasta soluissa
- kuvailla pääpiirteissään entsyymien toimintaa ja entsyymikinetiikan perusteita
- nimetä solutason keskeistä energiametaboliaa ja pääasiallisia metaboliareittejä
- tuottaa esimerkkejä DNA:n ja RNA:n rakenteista ja toiminnoista soluissa
- esittää esimerkkejä uusiutuvista raaka-aineista biotaloudessa
learningOutcomes.sv:
Efter kursen har den studerande kompentens att: 
-        Nämna centrala strukturer inom celler (växt, mikrob, djur)
-        Ge exempel på struktur och funktion av aminosyror och proteiner i celler 
-        Avbilda funktion av enzymer och grunder på enzymkinetik
-        Presentera central cell energetik och huvudsakliga metaboliska rutter
-        Framställa exempel på struktur och funktion av DNA och RNA inom celler 
Presentera exempel på förnybara råvaror inom bioekonomin
learningOutcomes.en:
After completing the course the student will be able to:
  1. Name basic structures of cells (plant, microbe, animal)
  2. Present examples of the structure and function of amino acids and proteins in cells
  3. Describe at a general level the function of enzymes and the basics of enzyme kinetics
  4. Present selected cell energy metabolism and principal metabolic routes
  5. Produce examples of the structure and function of DNA and RNA in cells 
  6. Provide examples of renewable raw materials with reference to the bio-economy

content.fi: Biomolekyylit (hiilihydraaatit, aminohapot, lipidit, nukleiinihappojen emäkset ja näistä rakentuvat polymeerit). Geenistä proteiiniksi. Biokatalyysin ja proteiinien toiminnan periaatteet: entsyymit ja niiden fysikaaliset, kemialliset, biologiset ja katalyyttiset ominaisuudet, entsyymikinetiikka, stabiilius ja aktiivisuus. Solujen energiametabolian perusteet. Biomolekyylien analyysimenetelmien perusteet. Biomolekyylit uusiutuvissa raaka-aineissa.
content.sv:
En grundkurs inom biokemi som handlar om:
  •        Biomolekyler (kolhydrater, aminosyror, lipider, baser av nukleinsyror och polymerer av dessa)
  •        Från gen till protein
  •        Grunderna i biokatalys och funktioner av proteiner: enzym och deras fysiska, kemiska, biologiska och katalytiska egenskaper, enzymkatalys, stabilitet och aktivitet
  •        Grunderna i cellernas energimetabolism
  •        Analysmetoder för biomolekyler
  •        Biomolekyler inom förnybara råvaror
content.en:
A basic course in biochemistry with focus on:
  1. Biomolecules (carbohydrates, amino acids, lipids, bases of nucleic acids and their polymers)
  2. From genes to proteins
  3. Basics of biocatalysis and function of proteins: enzymes and their physical, chemical, biological and catalytic properties, enzyme kinetics, stability and activity
  4. Basics of cell energy metabolism
  5. Analysis methods for biomolecules
  6. Biomolecules in renewable raw materials

Opiskelijat osallistuvat myös laboratoriodemonstraatioihin, mahdollisiin laskuharjoituksiin ja suorittavat itsenäisesti tai ryhmässä annettuja harjoitustehtäviä.  Arvostelu perustuu opiskelijan kurssin aikana suorittamiin harjoitus- tai muihin tehtäviin.

Deltagande i laboratoriedemonstrationer, utförande av möjliga räkneuppgifter och utförande av givna uppgifter personligt eller i grupp. Bedömningen är baserad på utförande av personligt utförda uppgifter eller grupparbeten som har gjorts under kursen.

prerequisites.fi: Laboratorioturvallisuuskurssi CHEM-A1010 tai CHEM-E0140 on oltava suoritettuna ennen laboratoriotöiden aloittamista.
prerequisites.sv: För deltagande i laborationerna krävs godkänd kurs i laborationssäkerhet, antingen CHEM-A1010 eller CHEM-E0140.
prerequisites.en: Laboratory safety course CHEM-A1010 or CHEM-E0140 must have been passed before performing any laboratory works in this course.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin suoritettuaan opiskelija osaa
- nimetä solujen (kasvi, mikrobi, eläin) perusrakenteita
- esittää esimerkkejä aminohappojen ja proteiinien rakenteista ja toiminnasta soluissa
- kuvailla pääpiirteissään entsyymien toimintaa ja entsyymikinetiikan perusteita
- nimetä solutason keskeistä energiametaboliaa ja pääasiallisia metaboliareittejä
- tuottaa esimerkkejä DNA:n ja RNA:n rakenteista ja toiminnoista soluissa
- esittää esimerkkejä uusiutuvista raaka-aineista biotaloudessa
learningOutcomes.sv:
Efter kursen har den studerande kompentens att: 
-        Nämna centrala strukturer inom celler (växt, mikrob, djur)
-        Ge exempel på struktur och funktion av aminosyror och proteiner i celler 
-        Avbilda funktion av enzymer och grunder på enzymkinetik
-        Presentera central cell energetik och huvudsakliga metaboliska rutter
-        Framställa exempel på struktur och funktion av DNA och RNA inom celler 
Presentera exempel på förnybara råvaror inom bioekonomin
learningOutcomes.en:
After completing the course the student will be able to:
  1. Name basic structures of cells (plant, microbe, animal)
  2. Present examples of the structure and function of amino acids and proteins in cells
  3. Describe at a general level the function of enzymes and the basics of enzyme kinetics
  4. Present selected cell energy metabolism and principal metabolic routes
  5. Produce examples of the structure and function of DNA and RNA in cells 
  6. Provide examples of renewable raw materials with reference to the bio-economy

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course the student :
- recognizes different types of unit operations and industrial scale processes used in biomass
valorization, conversion, bioprocessing and paper/board making
- knows the basic principles of these processes
- recognizes the main products manufactured with these processes and production plants
- understands the role of environmental technologies in industrial production processes
- understands how raw materials are used in a sustainable manner in production processes.

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: Courses in BSc level organic chemistry.
prerequisites.sv: Recommended prerequisites: Courses in BSc level organic chemistry.
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: Courses in BSc level organic chemistry.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course the student will be able to:
  • Understand and justify chemical reactivity based on molecular orbital theory.
  • Propose curved arrow mechanisms for complex organic reactions.
  • Understand and justify selectivities.
  • Understand stereoelectronic effects and be able to carry out conformational analyses for complex molecules.
  • Solve complex problems collaboratively.
learningOutcomes.sv:
After the course the student will be able to:
  • Understand and justify chemical reactivity based on molecular orbital theory.
  • Propose curved arrow mechanisms for complex organic reactions.
  • Understand and justify selectivities.
  • Understand stereoelectronic effects and be able to carry out conformational analyses for complex molecules.
  • Solve complex problems collaboratively.
learningOutcomes.en:
After the course the student will be able to:
  • Understand and justify chemical reactivity based on molecular orbital theory.
  • Propose curved arrow mechanisms for complex organic reactions.
  • Understand and justify selectivities.
  • Understand stereoelectronic effects and be able to carry out conformational analyses for complex molecules.
  • Solve complex problems collaboratively.

content.fi:
Developing a comprehensive understanding of organic structure and reactivity from first principles. Describing complex multi-step organic reactions using curved arrows and molecular orbitals. Using thermodynamic and kinetic arguments to justify chemical reactivity and selectivity. Advanced stereochemistry and conformational analysis of acyclic and cyclic systems.
After the course a student will have the theoretical tools needed to understand organic chemistry pertaining to e.g. natural product total synthesis, medicinal chemistry, polymer chemistry, biomass chemistry and supramolecular chemistry.

name.en: Wood Products and Processes, Online teaching

workload.fi: The course is mainly based on independent study in the online platform.
workload.sv: The course is mainly based on independent study in the online platform.
workload.en: The course is mainly based on independent study in the online platform.

prerequisites.fi: No prerequisites (recommended CHEM-C2470 Forests, Wood and Carbon, 5 cr and CHEM-E2225 Wood Material Science, 5cr)
prerequisites.sv: No prerequisites (recommended CHEM-C2470 Forests, Wood and Carbon, 5 cr and CHEM-E2225 Wood Material Science, 5cr)
prerequisites.en: No prerequisites (recommended CHEM-C2470 Forests, Wood and Carbon, 5 cr and CHEM-E2225 Wood Material Science, 5cr)

learningOutcomes.fi:
After this course students:
  • are familiar with the ambient conditions for wood products in different environments, such as indoor or outdoor applications, during service life
  • are familiar with the most common wood adhesive systems, their properties and application in wood products
  • are able to list the most common wood products, their setup and application range
  • know the whole production processes of selected wood products, such as plywood, cross-laminated timber, particleboards, fiberboards and modified wood products starting from raw material to the end product
  • know the impact of certain key process parameters and their effect on the performance of the products respectively
  • are able to describe how wood material properties (such as grain orientation and knots) influence the processing of wood into different products
  • are familiar with wood degradation mechanisms and preservation/modification methods to enhance the durability of wood

  • are familiar with wood degradation mechanisms and preservation/modification methods to enhance the durability of wood

content.fi: This course presents widely used wood-based products as well as those that have been recently developed. The production processes and structure of different engineered wood products, such as plywood, cross-laminated timber, and other timber and panel products, are described in detail. Links between wood product properties and typical applications in the living environment are presented. Further the course covers wood modification methods which affect the durability of wood.

Links between wood product properties and typical applications in the living environment are presented. Further the course covers wood modification methods which affect the durability of wood.

prerequisites.fi: No prerequisites (recommended CHEM-C2470 Forests, Wood and Carbon, 5 cr)
prerequisites.sv: No prerequisites (recommended CHEM-C2470 Forests, Wood and Carbon, 5 cr)
prerequisites.en: No prerequisites (recommended CHEM-C2470 Forests, Wood and Carbon, 5 cr)

learningOutcomes.fi:
After this course students:
  • appreciate the multifunctional role of forests in the climate- and eco-systems as well as the principles of sustainable forestry.
  • know how wood is formed through photosynthesis, how trees grow and can describe how environmental, genetic, and other factors influence wood formation.
  • know the key anatomical features of wood and can differentiate between softwood and hardwood as well how to identify wood species from their microstructures.
  • are familiar with the anisotropic nature of wood and be able to describe how the anatomical structure of wood affects its physical and mechanical properties.
  • know the states of water in wood and is familiar with the concepts of sorption, moisture content, equilibrium moisture content and fiber saturation point.
  • are able to describe how moisture affects the mechanical and physical properties of wood.
  • are able to calculate wood moisture content and list factors influencing the reliability of the results
  • are able to calculate wood density and describe anatomical factors influencing wood density
  • are familiar with the relationship between cell wall density, bulk density, and void volume (porosity) and can apply this information to predict how fluids may behave in wood.
  • are familiar with the thermal properties of wood, especially thermal conductivity, specific heat capacity, diffusivity and effusivity.
  • are familiar with the acoustic properties of wood and how this might be utilized in non-destructive testing and how it impacts on construction
  • are familiar with the electrical properties of wood and its application in measuring moisture content etc.
  • are familiar with the combustion properties of wood and its fire performance.
  • know about the short-term mechanical properties of wood and how structure/anatomy, density and moisture affect these is familiar with the long-term behavior of wood under static (creep) and cyclical loading (fatigue).
  • know the key degrading organisms that are responsible for the breakdown of wood

content.fi: Aimed at students wishing to specialize in the materials science of wood, this course will also be of interest to students of architecture, civil & structural engineering, materials science & engineering and related disciplines, who have an interest in the possibilities offered by wood. The course covers wood formation, wood structure & anatomy, wood-water relationships, and the physical properties of wood, including wood density & porosity, fluid flow in wood, the thermal & hygrothermal properties of wood, as well as acoustic properties. The course also covers short- and long-term mechanical properties and introduces students to the main agents responsible for wood degradation. Through this course, students will also appreciate the multi-functional role that forests play in providing ecosystem services as well as wood products.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin suoritettuaan opiskelija osaa
- kuvata ympäristön pilaantumiseen ja laatuun sekä ympäristötekniikkaan liittyviä kemiallisia, fysikaalisia ja biologisia mekanismeja ja niihin liittyviä suomenkielisiä käsitteitä
- kuvata ympäristön laatuun liittyviä kriteerejä ja seurantastrategioita
- luonnontieteitä ja erityisesti kemiaa paremmin

content.fi: Ilma-, vesi- ja maaperäkemian perusteet, aineiden kierto biosfäärissä, epäpuhtauksien leviäminen ja muuttuminen sekä päästöjen ja kemikaalien ympäristövaikutukset, ympäristönvaikutusten(terveysvaikutukset, happamoituminen, rehevöityminen, ilmastonmuutos yms.) mekanismit, veden ja ilman laatukriteerit, ympäristön tilan tarkkailu ja seuranta, ympäristötekniikkaan liittyvää kemiaa ja biologiaa.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course, student will be able to:
  1. explain the atomic structure and the basic principles of periodic table
  2. describe different types of chemical bonds in inorganic and organic compounds
  3. explain the significance of bonding for the structure and properties of matter, also from the point of view of applications
  4. write chemical reaction equations as well as know the basics of chemical equilibrium, and is able to apply them in practice
  5. understand how the structure of a molecule is connected to its reactivity

  3. explain the significance of bonding for the structure and properties of matter, also from the point of view of applications
  4. write chemical reaction equations as well as know the basics of chemical equilibrium, and is able to apply them in practice
  5. understand how the structure of a molecule is connected to its reactivity

content.fi:
• Atomic structure, elements and periodic table
  • Bonding and intermolecular forces in inorganic and organic compounds
  • Concept of stoichiometry and reaction equations
  • Concept of chemical equilibrium

workload.sv: Föreläsningar, räknestugor, självständiga studier, tentamen eller annan utvärdering.
workload.en: Lectures, exercises, independent study, final exam or other evaluation.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin suoritettuaan opiskelija osaa:
1. tunnistaa kuinka kemia on läsnä arjessa ja kuinka sitä hyödynnetään käytännön elämän ongelmien ratkaisemisessa
2. hahmottaa terveyteen, energiaan ja ympäristöön sekä tiedepolitiikkaan liittyviä päätöksiä
3. hyödyntää kemian perusymmärrystä alan ulkopuolisissa opinnoissa ja harjoituksissa
4. perusteet, joilla voi edetä kemiaan liittyvissä jatko-opinnoissa
learningOutcomes.sv:
Efter godkänd kurs ska studenten:
1. ha insikter i betydelsen av kemi och dess praktiska tillämpningar i vardagen
2. förstå bakgrunden till de beslut som tas gällande hälsa, energi och miljö samt vetenskapspolitik
3. ha en grundläggande inblick inom det kemiska området och därmed förstå de kemiska aspekterna i sitt arbete inom sin egen bransch
4. ha en grund för vidare kemistudier.
5. beskriva egenskaper hos och viktigaste tillämpningar för huvudgruppernas grundämnen och deras viktigaste föreningar.
6. beskriva de viktigaste ämnesklasserna inom organisk kemi, principerna för oljeraffinering, de viktigaste oljeprodukterna, biobränslen och de viktigaste plasterna.
7. identifiera kemiska riskfaktorer (giftiga ämnen, brännbara gaser och vätskor).
learningOutcomes.en:
After the course, the student is able to:
1. realize the presence of chemistry in everyday life, and how chemistry is applied to practical problems
2. perceive decisions about health, energy, environmental issues and science policy
3. employ chemistry in a non-chemistry environment
4. have a working knowledge that allows you to continue chemistry-realated studies.

content.fi:
Kemian peruskurssi, jossa perehdytään:
  • Atomin rakenteen, jaksollisen järjestelmän ja kemiallisen sitoutumisen perusperiaatteisiin
  • Kemiallisiin reaktioihin, reaktioyhtälöihin ja niiden soveltamiseen
  • Kemialliseen tasapainoon
  • Sähkökemiallisiin ilmiöihin
  • Materiaalikemiaan (esim. elektroniikka- ja energiamateriaalit sekä alkuainevarannot)
  • Orgaanisen kemian perusteisiin ja tuotteisiin
  • Kemialliseen työturvallisuuteen
content.sv:
Grundkurs i kemi, där följande ämnesområden behandlas:
  • Atomens struktur, periodiska systemet, kemisk bindning
  • Kemiska reaktioner, reaktionsformler och tillämpning av dessa
  • Kemisk jämvikt
  • Elektrokemiska fenomen
  • Materialkemi (t.ex. material som används inom elektronik- och energiindustrin samt tillgången på grundämnen)
  • Organiska kemins grunder och organiska produkter
  • Kemiskt arbetarskydd
content.en:
• The basics of atom, periodic table and chemical bonding
  • Chemical reactions and reaction equations
  • Chemical equilibria
  • Electrochemical phenomena
  • Materials chemistry (e.g. electronics, energy and elemental resources)
  • Principles of organic chemistry and their most typical products
  • Chemical safety

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course the student will be able to:
  • Have an understanding of modern organic chemistry as a field (medicinal chemistry, material science, agriculture, molecular electronics eg.).
  • Critically read publications in the broader field of organic chemistry.
  • Understand how the publication process works, what are they key publication forums and how open access/preprint servers work.
  • Summarize and analyze publications in a concise way.
  • Understand and experience how strong communities can support learning.
  • Produce high production quality chemical graphics and slides.

content.fi: Why do some papers appear in Science and Nature, and others don't? What's open access? Have I been reading publications wrong all this time? Scientific publications are the basis onto which we build all science, and this course focuses on understanding them. Each year the organic chemistry literature club course will focus on key topics the students are interested in. Recent publications on each key chosen topic, such as medicinal chemistry, materials science, catalysis eg., are discussed to understand the key features of modern scientific publishing.

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: Previous experience with the Computational Chemistry and Programming courses is advantageous.
prerequisites.sv: Recommended prerequisites: Previous experience with the Computational Chemistry and Programming courses is advantageous.
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: Previous experience with the Computational Chemistry and Programming courses is advantageous.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course the student:
  1. Will be able to recognize the basic terminology employed in the field of machine learning and AI: supervised vs unsupervised learning; regression vs classification models.
  2. Will understand the fundamentals of data analysis and probability: prior and posterior probabilities, and the Bayesian interpretation of probability.
  3. Will know the basic features of mainstream models and algorithms: kernel/Gaussian regression, artificial neural networks, random forests, clustering, dimensionality reduction, low-dimensional embedding/visualization, image recognition, large language models, etc.
  4. Will get some hands-on experience using mainstream ML/AI Python libraries/packages, like Sklearn and Pytorch, applied to relevant examples in chemistry and materials science (e.g., detecting atomic patterns in atomic force microscopy images).
  5. Will get hands-on supervised experience applying the learnt principles to solve a small project of their choice, e.g., searching for stable molecules/materials with machine learning potentials, extending a large language model to include a given set of literature items, cataloguing a set of micrographs or spectrographs, training a high-dimensional model from a database of experimental results, etc. This will equip the student with the practical tools to use AI/ML to solve problems in their industrial or academic job after the course.

content.fi:
Valid for whole curriculum period:
  1. Fundamentals of machine learning and AI: theory and algorithms.
  2. Mainstream Python libraries for basic AI/machine learning tasks: regression, classification, pattern recognition.
  3. Contemporary use of machine learning and AI in chemical research (industry/academia) and production/processes (industry).
  4. Selected examples relevant to research in the Chemistry and Materials Science department, e.g., machine learning potentials for atomistic modeling.
  5. Selected seminars by invited academics and Finnish industry representatives.

content.fi: Silicon and thin film materials. Unit processes in microfabrication: lithography, etching, deposition, oxidation, doping, polishing, bonding. Process integration of CMOS and MEMS devices. Cleanrooms, process equipment, yield and reliability. Lab demo.
